commit_message:
Gracefully fail if branches have no tags

If some of the branches have no tags at all (like in the case
of feature branches or early master branches), the listing of
branches in list-changes fails.

This problem was introduced in I4f06d6cfaa8ea332d9326ccd8a5e69c749589529
since we switched to subprocess' check_output instead of call.

Change-Id: Id8c61662ecf3a9424c3b4e21fb36f0ed8c01d6b1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/releases refs/changes/47/447547/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if not branch.startswith('feature/'): description = subprocess.check_output( ['git', 'describe', branch], cwd=os.path.join(workdir, repo), ).decode('utf-8').strip() print('{:<30} {}'.format(branch, description))
deleted_lines: description = subprocess.check_output( ['git', 'describe', branch], cwd=os.path.join(workdir, repo), ).decode('utf-8').strip() print('{:<30} {}'.format(branch, description))

Co-Authored-By: YAMAMOTO Takashi <yamamoto@midokura.com>

commit_message:
devstack: added new neutron-* aliases for services

All services except q-sriov-agt now have their neutron-* counterparts.
The only service left behind is the SRIOV agent since it's not critical
to cover it right now, because it's not deployed in gate with the new
lib/neutron code.

Change-Id: I2fbd7649b6ef312940dca704ed3ebdb1e2e93576
Co-Authored-By: YAMAMOTO Takashi <yamamoto@midokura.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/95/445295/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if is_service_enabled q-flavors neutron-flavors; then if is_service_enabled q-qos neutron-qos; then if is_service_enabled q-trunk neutron-trunk; then if is_service_enabled q-dns neutron-dns; then if is_service_enabled q-dns neutron-dns; then if is_service_enabled q-agt neutron-agent; then #Therefore we create new service, q-sriov-agt, and the # q-agt/neutron-agent should be OVS or linux bridge.
deleted_lines: if is_service_enabled q-flavors; then if is_service_enabled q-qos; then if is_service_enabled q-trunk; then if is_service_enabled q-dns; then if is_service_enabled q-dns; then if is_service_enabled q-agt; then #Therefore we create new service, q-sriov-agt, and the q-agt should be OVS #or linux bridge.

subject: Add sushy under Ironic governance
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-13 18:45:38.000000000', 'files': ['reference/projects.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/governance/commit/de6985df6cbb55d04cec6948e1a9b596336cec83', 'message': 'Add sushy under Ironic governance

Sushy is a Python library to communicate with Redfish based systems
(http://www.dmtf.org/standards/redfish) which is currently being used to
create a "redfish" driver/hardware type for Ironic.

In the upstream meeting on 2017-03-13 it was discussed whether we want
to include it under the Ironic's governance or not [0] and the conclusion
is yes, we want it to be part of the governance.

[0] http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/meetings/ironic/2017/ironic.2017-03-13-17.00.log.html#l-362

Change-Id: I8bc6d02653be8c34eea3dbe768ab45a68aed1d11
'}]
commit_message:
Add sushy under Ironic governance

Sushy is a Python library to communicate with Redfish based systems
(http://www.dmtf.org/standards/redfish) which is currently being used to
create a "redfish" driver/hardware type for Ironic.

In the upstream meeting on 2017-03-13 it was discussed whether we want
to include it under the Ironic's governance or not [0] and the conclusion
is yes, we want it to be part of the governance.

[0] http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/meetings/ironic/2017/ironic.2017-03-13-17.00.log.html#l-362

Change-Id: I8bc6d02653be8c34eea3dbe768ab45a68aed1d11
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/governance refs/changes/46/445046/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: sushy: repos: - openstack/sushy

commit_message:
oslopolicy-sample-generator description support

With the idea of adding a more descriptive policy rule so
operators can understand what a policy rule controls. This
patch ensures `oslopolicy-sample-generator` adds the
api(s) and method(s) {if given} to policy description.

Change-Id: If4ca9bc191ac263f861373c432a1fafc3f7d596e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.policy refs/changes/30/443330/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if default.operations: for operation in default.operations: text += ('# %(method)s %(path)s\n' % {'method': operation['method'], 'path': operation['path']})

commit_message:
[arch-design] Publish draft Arch Guide to docs.openstack.org

1. Unpublish the current arch-design and temporarily relocate it to a
"to archive" directory until the archiving structure is available
2. Publish the arch-design-draft to docs.openstack.org
3. Unpublish arch-design-draft from https://docs.openstack.org/draft/

Change-Id: Ida5f237d2edce7a83a24c376c355e2c220bc8c28
Implements: blueprint arch-design-pike

commit_message:
Add attributes schema for OS::Keystone::User

Add `attributes_schema` and `_resolve_attribute` for OS::Keystone::User.
This patch allow get_attr works with OS::Keystone::User resource.
Partial-Bug: #1648004
Closes-bug: #1659923

Co-Authored-By: Rico Lin <rico.lin.guanyu@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I4e8e984c42120e23887ad9997df2fa530709be52

commit_message:
Add precommit notifications for create/update port/network in ML2

In some cases (like for validation of QoS rules in QoS
service plugin) it is necessary to send notifications
before commit create/update port and before commit
updated network.
This patch adds such notifications to be send from
ML2 plugin.

Change-Id: I89c59ad51ec59458c69a7363fc75190c6e4c9551
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/82/447682/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: kwargs = {'context': context, 'network': updated_network, 'original_network': original_network} registry.notify( resources.NETWORK, events.PRECOMMIT_UPDATE, self, **kwargs) kwargs = {'context': context, 'port': result} registry.notify( resources.PORT, events.PRECOMMIT_CREATE, self, **kwargs) kwargs = { 'context': context, 'port': updated_port, 'original_port': original_port, } registry.notify( resources.PORT, events.PRECOMMIT_UPDATE, self, **kwargs)

commit_message:

commit_message:
Disable process monitor for keepalived test

There was an existing attempt to disable process monitoring, but
since the AGENT.check_child_processes_interval defaults to 60 and
is checked in ProcessMonitor.__init__, overriding the config value
after instantiating the ProcessMonitor only has the affect of
making the check happen continually as quickly as possible instead
of not at all. Instead, we instantiate the process monitor after
changing the config value.

Change-Id: Ic4907b6a227c6fa8288c9d3e2106da0b53323509
Closes-Bug: #1665061
(cherry picked from commit 0faf1aa49f18e8dcbee6ea8be78f6e918090e0a1)

commit_message:
l3scheduler: create ha_vr_id more robustly

In some cases, the creation of the ha_vr_id could have occurred twice.
For example, if a router was created with a given external_gateway then
a vr_id would be allocated twice: once from super().create_router()
(which triggers the scheduler on its own), and once from the
create_router() logic.

This patch modifies some code paths to make this allocation more robust.
For example the code that allocates a new vr_id will now also assign it
to the router in the same transaction, to make sure atomicity.

Closes-Bug: #1654032
Change-Id: I82c33aee5cfcc086f60fc74ed4d7bd7d443a3370
(cherry picked from commit 7c0e62ee2f8eb7325cc21245db4825a7f7e5df13)

subject: Don't create HA resources until needed
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-10 16:11:19.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/db/l3_hamode_db.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/plugins/ml2/drivers/l2pop/test_mech_driver.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/scheduler/test_l3_agent_scheduler.py', 'neutron/scheduler/l3_agent_scheduler.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/db/test_l3_hamode_db.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/b3f4e128417dbeaa18081a39497b1c1705483cc6', 'message': "Don't create HA resources until needed

Change I3447ea5bcb7c57365c6f50efe12a1671e86588b3 introduced a new
running-index for RouterL3AgentBinding, binding_index, which helps to
keep count of how many bindings a router has for each agent (and how
many bindings in total). Since we were able use this DB column to make
sure concurrency doesn't break on creating a new HA router, we also
postponed the creation of L3HARouterAgentPortBinding to after the first
binding was successfully created.

This patch proposes a change to the way routers are scheduled to an
agent: when creating a new HA router, no L3HARouterAgentPortBinding
entities will be created until after the corresponding
RouterL3AgentBinding was successfully created.
In other words, instead of pre-creating the L3HARouterAgentPortBinding
objects without assigning it to an agent, we'll create them only after
the RouterL3AgentBinding were successfully created.

Conflicts:
	neutron/scheduler/l3_agent_scheduler.py
	neutron/tests/unit/db/test_l3_hamode_db.py

commit_message:
Don't create HA resources until needed

Change I3447ea5bcb7c57365c6f50efe12a1671e86588b3 introduced a new
running-index for RouterL3AgentBinding, binding_index, which helps to
keep count of how many bindings a router has for each agent (and how
many bindings in total). Since we were able use this DB column to make
sure concurrency doesn't break on creating a new HA router, we also
postponed the creation of L3HARouterAgentPortBinding to after the first
binding was successfully created.

This patch proposes a change to the way routers are scheduled to an
agent: when creating a new HA router, no L3HARouterAgentPortBinding
entities will be created until after the corresponding
RouterL3AgentBinding was successfully created.
In other words, instead of pre-creating the L3HARouterAgentPortBinding
objects without assigning it to an agent, we'll create them only after
the RouterL3AgentBinding were successfully created.

Conflicts:
	neutron/scheduler/l3_agent_scheduler.py
	neutron/tests/unit/db/test_l3_hamode_db.py

Related-Bug: #1609738
Change-Id: Ie98d5e3760cdb17450aea546f4b61f5ba14baf1c
(cherry picked from commit 2ad9c679ed8718633732da1e97307f9fd9647dcc)

subject: Turn nova notifier into a proper rate limiter
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-20 20:48:58.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/notifiers/batch_notifier.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/notifiers/test_batch_notifier.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/b7e12b276a58830130781eb9a81154834698b62b', 'message': 'Turn nova notifier into a proper rate limiter

This adjusts the batching logic in the Nova notifier to immediately
send and then sleep to allow batching of subsequent calls in the batch
interval.

So rather than always wait for 2 seconds to elapse while batching,
batching will only occur in the 2 second period after a call is made.
This turns the batch notifier into a standard queuing rate limiter.

The upside to this is a single port create results in an immediate
notification to Nova without a delay.

The downside is now that a sudden burst of 6 port creations to a
previously idle server will result in 2 notification calls to Nova
(1 for the first call and another for the other 5).

Closes-Bug: #1564648
Change-Id: I82f403441564955345f47877151e0c457712dd2f
(cherry picked from commit 255e8a839db0be10c98b5d9f480ce476e2f2e171)
'}]
commit_message:
Turn nova notifier into a proper rate limiter

This adjusts the batching logic in the Nova notifier to immediately
send and then sleep to allow batching of subsequent calls in the batch
interval.

So rather than always wait for 2 seconds to elapse while batching,
batching will only occur in the 2 second period after a call is made.
This turns the batch notifier into a standard queuing rate limiter.

The upside to this is a single port create results in an immediate
notification to Nova without a delay.

The downside is now that a sudden burst of 6 port creations to a
previously idle server will result in 2 notification calls to Nova
(1 for the first call and another for the other 5).

Closes-Bug: #1564648
Change-Id: I82f403441564955345f47877151e0c457712dd2f
(cherry picked from commit 255e8a839db0be10c98b5d9f480ce476e2f2e171)

subject: Fix lock contention in SolidFire driver
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-15 22:57:38.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/solidfire.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/volume/drivers/solidfire/test_solidfire.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/eceade74b8b86f8e481f3b8ab2073e0b3d90aa47', 'message': "Fix lock contention in SolidFire driver

I'm an idiot an introduced a double lock around the
same resource here:
    commit fb9ed782f1cac63a16f1f41f4e45c6c1031bff81

This patch removes the lock decorator from the inner
_do_clone method and puts a common source lock around
the public calls to clone and clone-from-snapshot,
while preserving the intent of the image-id lock around
clone_image.

Change-Id: If9145dbaf3678522beea14c613055049f5757a98
Closes-Bug: #1673264
"}]
commit_message:
Fix lock contention in SolidFire driver

I'm an idiot an introduced a double lock around the
same resource here:
    commit fb9ed782f1cac63a16f1f41f4e45c6c1031bff81

This patch removes the lock decorator from the inner
_do_clone method and puts a common source lock around
the public calls to clone and clone-from-snapshot,
while preserving the intent of the image-id lock around
clone_image.

Change-Id: If9145dbaf3678522beea14c613055049f5757a98
Closes-Bug: #1673264

commit_message:
Explicitly configure credentials used by ironic to access other services

Using keystone_authtoken credentials for this purpose is deprecated, and also
prevents ironic-conductor from being used as a separate role.

Also remove neutron_url, it can be fetched from the catalog instead.

Change-Id: I12822568cb4db31808aec5fd407d71fe4b7b09e0
Depends-On: I21180678bec911f1be36e3b174bae81af042938c
Partial-Bug: #1661250

commit_message:
Explicitly configure credentials used by ironic to access other services

Using keystone_authtoken credentials for this purpose is deprecated, and also
prevents ironic-conductor from being used as a separate role.

As a side effect, this change makes it possible to potentially enable
ironic-inspector support in the future (it's not enabled yet).

Change-Id: I21180678bec911f1be36e3b174bae81af042938c
Partial-Bug: #1661250

commit_message:
tempest: Skip QoS test until fixed

The test is failing intermittently. In order to reach a better stability
of the job running in-tree tempest tests, this patch skips the test
until we come up with a proper fix.

Change-Id: I37f1488db258f6a4d383fb472cb5433c65371ac5
Related-bug: 1662109
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/11/437011/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: Remove duplicate SQL request on firewall update
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-01 17:28:14.000000000', 'files': ['neutron_fwaas/services/firewall/fwaas_plugin_v2.py', 'neutron_fwaas/services/firewall/fwaas_plugin.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron-fwaas/commit/cb899e9bd49fd2a097ae3ed1e86d859b49e318e9', 'message': 'Remove duplicate SQL request on firewall update

When firewall or firewall_group are updated without
router_ids or ports parameter, an SQL request is
actually performed twice.
With this fix, only one SQL request will be done.

Change-Id: I331622319142d8f9eadf9a9ad192c8cf3ba69724
'}]
commit_message:
Remove duplicate SQL request on firewall update

When firewall or firewall_group are updated without
router_ids or ports parameter, an SQL request is
actually performed twice.
With this fix, only one SQL request will be done.

Change-Id: I331622319142d8f9eadf9a9ad192c8cf3ba69724

commit_message:
Use session from OSC plugin

The commit below this one [1] adds support for using a session. This one
makes use of that from the OSC plugin, since it already has a working
keystone-session thanks to the generic bits of the OSC CLI code.

[1] I4fccb4117db11c966ac3f17ec6d2a53c657378e8

Change-Id: Ibefb071f28ff7239bce082f0947985af6d8e2f27

deleted_lines: client = workflow_client( mistral_url=mistral_url, auth_token=instance.auth_ref.auth_token, project_id=instance.auth_ref.project_id, user_id=instance.auth_ref.user_id, )

commit_message:
Accept keystone session in client

This already has auth configured, and allows us to re-use the session
even with other clients. Currently this is not used by the CLI; however
this is useful when instantiating the mistral client from a python
script or from another service.

Change-Id: I4fccb4117db11c966ac3f17ec6d2a53c657378e8

commit_message:
Wrong version in ops APIs.

Min version of ops API is 1.4, so we need to add min_version in
document.

Closes-Bug: #1673311

commit_message:
Add ipv6 address for lo interface

setup-hosts play fails during first pass as lxcbr0 doesn't come up
because the ifup scripts depend on ipv6 address for lo interface.
Added kernel option to enable ipv6 on lo interface.

Change-Id: Ia0f067d11ce4d327f3bb83169c0f29af170b9229
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-openstack_hosts refs/changes/43/447343/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Update all SHAs for 13.3.17

This patch updates all the roles to the latest available stable
SHA's, copies the release notes from the updated roles into the
integrated repo, updates all the OpenStack Service SHA's, and
updates the appropriate python requirements pins.

Depends-On: I33fdcb5ffeb1dd74c20b5204784ea08239a14ecb
Change-Id: Ie83264ddf2996b66a7b8c42b73f3095ae2d05d83

commit_message:
Fix monitoring issue for multiple VDUs

Tacker failed to support monitoring for multiple VDUs.
In addtiion, multi-vdu testing have not been mentioned in unit test.
This patch will fixed the above issues.

Change-Id: Ib4497a530439110bf149f1104c74ba4bdc96ba0a
Closes-bug: #1668587

commit_message:
Add ldlinux.c32 to the tftp directory

This patch adds a task to copy ldlinux.c32 to the tftp directory
when on ubuntu 16.04. Also, changed the copy tasks to a unique
task making use of the copy module with 'remote_src: True'.

Change-Id: I4a71c198ad11d293e15f8a80bc1dcd0c6e6aa479
(cherry picked from commit 1ed97c1a37bfa8575e4f29cbf00199b17ab36ef2)

commit_message:
Add support for neutron network names for cleaning/provisioning

This patch adds the ability to specify a cleaning and provisioning
network for Ironic. If none are specified then Ironic continues to
function as it does now.

Ironic role will calculate the UUID of the neutron network assuming a
network name is provided.

Additionally, this is added to testing by configuring a network to add
with the network-name.

This patch fixes a few minor issues:
* The ironic_service_user_name was not being passed to Nova
  - this value was fixed in Nova #1647253
* The br-flat network seems to already existing on some gate nodes, this
has been changed to named br-vlan

This is a combined backport of the following changes:
I9be6f351c0da292ac8b861d2168e73d1861e1603
I12f68a1cda39a3d615fbcf6ad62694faca6d09f4

Change-Id: Ibd053f71c3e2b52d8f6a22f7287c211a354e4118

This patch combines infrastructure required changes and
new sNAT application (chassis based sNAT).
There is another strategy mode (tenant sNAT to be delivered separately

Chassis sNAT mode has 4 configuration parameters
 - external_host_ip (no default)
 - external_host_mac
 - enable_goto_flows (default: True)
 - test_mode (default: True)

'test_mode' is required for correct treatment in fullstack mode

-Added support for devstack SNAT_HOST_IP variable to
 set 'external_host_ip' parameter from devstack local.conf
-Added mixin class instead common sNAT base class

UpgradeImpact: OVS version>=2.6
Partially-Implements: blueprint snat-distribution

commit_message:
SNAT application - infra and chassis sNAT strategy

This patch combines infrastructure required changes and
new sNAT application (chassis based sNAT).
There is another strategy mode (tenant sNAT to be delivered separately

Chassis sNAT mode has 2 configuration parameters
 - external_host_ip (no default)
 - enable_goto_flows (default: True)

-Added support for devstack SNAT_HOST_IP variable to
 set 'external_host_ip' parameter from devstack local.conf
-Added mixin class instead common sNAT base class

UpgradeImpact: OVS version>=2.6
Partially-Implements: blueprint snat-distribution
Change-Id: I7aadb10489d2bee7b2662be83da05a206afed786

commit_message:
Keep existing data for containerized ironic-conductor

Use mounts instead of docker volumes, and preserve existing data when
moving from baremetal to containerized ironic-conductor.

We cannot keep the data in the same directory to avoid hard-linking
errors in ironic, because of this issue:

https://github.com/docker/docker/issues/7457

This means we need to copy the data over to a new location before we
start the containers.

Change-Id: If98460120212f887b06adf117c5d88b97682638e

commit_message:
Disable exit on error for pacemaker commands for update flow

Package update fails on compute node, when yum_update checks for
pacemaker status via systemctl command. Because exit on error (-e)
option has been enabled recently, this issue is happening. Fixing
by, executing the command only on nodes where pacemaker is enabled.
Closes-Bug: #1668266

Change-Id: I2aae4e2fdfec526c835f8967b54e1db3757bca17
(cherry picked from commit e9a2fdc0afd2a3f1242f397c5f164cf6b43c2669)

commit_message:
Reuse API v2 for v1 calls

The v2 API code can be reused for the v1 API with just minor
tweaks to the returned JSON and a couple changes in the HTTP
response code.

Change-Id: I852a383bf8041220490abde74dfe0a65376b924e
Closes-bug: #1627921

This is a little silly, as ``display_name`` needs to be switched to just ``name``, which internally to v2 gets switched to be ``display_name``. Oh well. """ if 'display_name' in req.GET: req.GET['name'] = req.GET.pop('display_name') return req class SnapshotsController(snapshots_v2.SnapshotsController): result = super(SnapshotsController, self).show(req, id) return _snapshot_v2_to_v1(result) return _snapshot_v2_to_v1( super(SnapshotsController, self).index( _update_search_opts(req))) return _snapshot_v2_to_v1( super(SnapshotsController, self).detail( _update_search_opts(req))) @wsgi.response(200) if (body is None or not body.get('snapshot') or not isinstance(body['snapshot'], dict)): if 'display_name' in body['snapshot']: body['snapshot']['name'] = body['snapshot'].pop('display_name') if 'display_description' in body['snapshot']: body['snapshot']['description'] = body['snapshot'].pop( 'display_description') if 'metadata' not in body['snapshot']: body['snapshot']['metadata'] = {} return _snapshot_v2_to_v1( super(SnapshotsController, self).create(req, body)) try: return _snapshot_v2_to_v1( super(SnapshotsController, self).update(req, id, body)) except exc.HTTPBadRequest:

Not found exception will be handled at the wsgi level snapshot = self.volume_api.get_snapshot(context, id) req.cache_db_snapshot(snapshot) return {'snapshot': _translate_snapshot_detail_view(snapshot)} def delete(self, req, id): """Delete a snapshot.""" context = req.environ['cinder.context'] LOG.info(_LI("Delete snapshot with id: %s"), id) # Not found exception will be handled at the wsgi level snapshot = self.volume_api.get_snapshot(context, id) self.volume_api.delete_snapshot(context, snapshot) return webob.Response(status_int=202) return self._items(req, entity_maker=_translate_snapshot_summary_view) return self._items(req, entity_maker=_translate_snapshot_detail_view) def _items(self, req, entity_maker): """Returns a list of snapshots, transformed through entity_maker.""" context = req.environ['cinder.context'] # Not found exception will be handled at the wsgi level volume = self.volume_api.get(context, volume_id) force = snapshot.get('force', False) msg = _LI("Create snapshot from volume %s") LOG.info(msg, volume_id) if not strutils.is_valid_boolstr(force): msg = _("Invalid value '%s' for force. ") % force raise exception.InvalidParameterValue(err=msg) if strutils.bool_from_string(force): new_snapshot = self.volume_api.create_snapshot_force( context, volume, snapshot.get('display_name'), snapshot.get('display_description'), **kwargs) else: new_snapshot = self.volume_api.create_snapshot( context, volume, snapshot.get('display_name'), snapshot.get('display_description'), **kwargs) req.cache_db_snapshot(new_snapshot) retval = _translate_snapshot_detail_view(new_snapshot) return {'snapshot': retval} context = req.environ['cinder.context'] if not body: if 'snapshot' not in body: raise exc.HTTPUnprocessableEntity() snapshot = body['snapshot'] update_dict = {} valid_update_keys = ( 'display_name', 'display_description', ) for key in valid_update_keys: if key in snapshot: update_dict[key] = snapshot[key] # Not found exception will be handled at the wsgi level snapshot = self.volume_api.get_snapshot(context, id) self.volume_api.update_snapshot(context, snapshot, update_dict) snapshot.update(update_dict) req.cache_db_snapshot(snapshot) return {'snapshot': _translate_snapshot_detail_view(snapshot)}

commit_message:
Set backup available after verify

In backup import request, the backup is set to available before
it is verified. Then if the verification failed, the backup's
status is set to error. This leads to an unreasonble status change:
creating -> available -> error.

The available status should be set after the verification when
all work is done. And the status change should be like:
creating -> available, or creating -> error

Closes-bug: #1669628
Change-Id: I67f30df8a8112c953f24f6d2f7d5152416d4f0df

commit_message:
Fix action on services raises TypeError

Freeze, thaw and failover_host actions on a service raises TypeError
when non-existent host or cluster name is passed to the service
update API. This TypeError exception raised is converted into
HTTPBadRequest at wsgi layer.

Fixed this issue by formatting error message when a service is not
found for a given host or cluster. Caught the ServiceNotFound at API
layer and raised InvalidInput error so a user will see 400 error
only instead of 404.

Closes-Bug: #1663205
Change-Id: I54b9575f293f64a5f31246d0345c753b8011d95f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/03/439403/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if host: msg = _("No service found with host=%s") % host else: msg = _("No service found with cluster=%s") % cluster_name raise exception.ServiceNotFound(msg)
deleted_lines: msg = _('No service found with ') + ( 'host=%(host)s' if host else 'cluster=%(cluster_name)s') raise exception.ServiceNotFound(msg, host=host, cluster_name=cluster_name)

commit_message:
Fix size update error for snapshot-manage operation

After snapshot-manage operation we have incorrect update
because the snapshots table in DB doesn't contain 'size' column.
This patch fix this problem.

Change-Id: I84031a87803fd5314eb7a605d5439cf3e2c49332
Closes-Bug: #1623596
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/62/426162/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: model_update.update({'volume_size': size})

commit_message:
3PAR: rally test create-volume-from-snapshot fails

Rally test executes below steps
1. create snapshot (successful)
2. create volume from snapshot (successful)
3. delete snapshot (failed because volume created
   from snapshot is not deleted yet)

3par driver creates child and parent relationship
while creating volume from snapshot. Proposed code
change will create indipendent volume from snapshot.

Modified unit tests according to driver code change.

Closes-Bug: #1656186

Change-Id: Icb4f015867ee06b5e3a186a9900a46c0f61240ef
(cherry picked from commit 5f2074e1092f07c3420877fa00d1c49efde6e420)

commit_message:
Validate display_name/description attributes in API layer

We have string length checks for 'name' and 'description' in
API layer, Add validations for 'display_name' and
'display_description'.

Change-Id: I8c11d155d50800f7099466896abaa0a04f8c49cd
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/89/436689/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: for attribute in ['name', 'description', 'display_name', 'display_description']: value = body.get(attribute) if value is not None: if isinstance(value, six.string_types): body[attribute] = value.strip() try: utils.check_string_length(body[attribute], attribute, min_length=0, max_length=255) except exception.InvalidInput as error: raise webob.exc.HTTPBadRequest(explanation=error.msg)
deleted_lines: name = body.get('name') if name is not None: if isinstance(name, six.string_types): body['name'] = name.strip() try: utils.check_string_length(body['name'], 'Name', min_length=0, max_length=255) except exception.InvalidInput as error: raise webob.exc.HTTPBadRequest(explanation=error.msg) description = body.get('description') if description is not None: try: utils.check_string_length(description, 'Description', min_length=0, max_length=255) except exception.InvalidInput as error: raise webob.exc.HTTPBadRequest(explanation=error.msg)

commit_message:
Purge immediately on Delete in SolidFire Driver

This just adds an explicit and immediate purge call when
deleting volumes.  This will eliminate a number of corner
cases that can cause problems with the inventory.

Change-Id: I639af419d6ab279b62faac6c526273aff19e692b
Closes-Bug: #1668777

commit_message:
api-ref: v2 update volume metadata description is wrong

Modify metadata description regarding update volume. The reasons are as follows.
In line 348, current description of metadata is talking about a snapshot rather
than a volume, and this metadata should be optional as part of a request body.
In line 376, the description of metadata is talking about a snapshot rather
than a volume, and this metadata should be required as part of a response.

Change-Id: I9647ce149760121f3140fe820f350aa2d8589ae0
Closes-Bug: #1668301

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/49/447749/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: The freezer client is the command-line interface (CLI) for the Backup, Restore, and Disaster Recovery service (freezer) API and its extensions. This chapter documents :command:`freezer` version ``1.3.0``. usage: freezer backup-delete [-h] backup_uuid``backup_uuid`` UUID of the backup backup_uuid``backup_uuid`` usage: freezer job-create [-h] --file FILE --client CLIENT_ID``--client CLIENT_ID, -C`` CLIENT_ID Select a client for this job .. _freezer_session-start: freezer session-start --------------------- .. code-block:: console usage: freezer session-start [-h] --session-id SESSION_ID --job-id JOB_ID --job-tag JOB_TAG Start a session **Optional arguments:** ``-h, --help`` show this help message and exit ``--session-id SESSION_ID`` ID of the session ``--job-id JOB_ID`` ID of the job ``--job-tag JOB_TAG`` Job tag value
deleted_lines: The freezer client is the command-line interface (CLI) for the Backup, Restore, and Disaster Recovery service (freezer) API and its extensions. This chapter documents :command:`freezer` version ``1.2.0``. usage: freezer backup-delete [-h] backup_id``backup_id`` ID of the backup backup_id``backup_id`` usage: freezer job-create [-h] --file FILE

commit_message:
Remove domains *-log-* from compile_catalog

Translation for logs are being retired [1] and compile_catalog
will fail once they are not found.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-i18n/2017-March/002799.html

Change-Id: I17d7400fd7283662bac2c250688f10074e8ac697

commit_message:
Fix query-zanata

Change I2d1638296f264784333ba1745f75490d81b9ca00 overwrote the content
flag and now the script does not return JSON as expected but XML.
Change it to continue returning JSON.

Also, use newer ProjectVersionResource REST API since the old one is
deprecated.

Change-Id: Idf493813d20d40cc92aaaffbe23db227eb1a213a

commit_message:
set eager=True for actionplan.list

actionplan.save() will send a send_update notification.
This notification need eagerly loaded,
so we should set eager=True for actionplan.list.

Change-Id: Iafe35b9782fb0cc52ba5121c155f62c61ef70e1f
Closes-Bug: #1673679

commit_message:
Adding instructions for rebasing

As per bug, added instructions for manually rebasing a commit.

Change-Id: I59135091b2097c76408da1d086eac8572fe5a826
Closes-Bug: #1673315
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/42/447342/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: * You have a merge conflict, and your patch needs to be rebased Sometimes your change will create a merge conflict with another patch. In this case, you will need to rebase your commit on top of the current state of the repository. In many cases, this can be achieved by pressing the ``Rebase`` button in the gerrit interface. If this fails, though, you will need to perform it manually. Instructions are in the `Infra Manual <https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html#understanding-changes-and-patch-sets>_`

commit_message:
install and launch dispnynode.pp

The dispynode.pp should work on each of the node in a cloud. This
patch-set installs and starts that process on the master and slaves
nodes of an environment.

Change-Id: I7eb6ddf823ea9ab85eb8b0ceaa6eb3243a21ce85
Implements: blueprint distributed-serialization

commit_message:
Replaces uuid.uuid4 with uuidutils.generate_uuid()

Openstack common has a wrapper for generating uuids. We should
use that function when generating uuids for consistency.

Change-Id: Ie79e07207f51ae4f58c150381354a948d1eb7954

commit_message:
Remove log translations

Log messages are no longer being translated. This removes all use of
the _LE, _LI, and _LW translation markers to simplify logging and to
avoid confusion with new contributions.

See:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-i18n/2016-November/002574.html
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-March/113365.html

Change-Id: I62bf3bda7a0769fc8ff941d8238222beb392cf68

commit_message:
Cleanup docker services templates

Use yaml anchors wherever possible for image definition and drop unused
anchors.

Renamed parameters to Docker*ConfigImage to clarify that an image is
specifically used to generate configuration files.

Change-Id: I388bd59de7f1d36a3a881fbb723ba5bcba09e637

subject: Fix device taging after API microversion 2.37
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-01-23 07:08:33.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/376c04eb129e596455efa961e6a1da0d847470fb', 'message': 'Fix device taging after API microversion 2.37

Device tagging support was added in microversion 2.32, as for
ports:
http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/nova/tree/nova/api/openstack/compute/schemas/servers.py#n76
but in latter microversion 2.37 accidentally removed it:
http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/nova/tree/nova/api/openstack/compute/schemas/servers.py#n82

And for bdms:
the schema is added by
https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/api/openstack/compute/block_device_mapping.py#L76
and it will only work for microversion 2.32

So this function is only usable from microversion 2.32 to 2.37 for
ports and only for 2.32 for bdms.

we should fix it and backport to Newton.

Change-Id: I0e498ccc3503386b6da2f72686c7f9aa85876588
Closes-Bug: #1658571
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2017-01-23 08:28:12.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/427ed059ca98502080c4c04ee944d63df75dd31e', 'message': 'Fix device taging after API microversion 2.37

Device tagging support was added in microversion 2.32, as for
ports:
http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/nova/tree/nova/api/openstack/compute/schemas/servers.py#n76
but in latter microversion 2.37 accidentally removed it:

commit_message:
Fix device taging after API microversion 2.37

Device tagging support was added in microversion 2.32, as for
ports:
http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/nova/tree/nova/api/openstack/compute/schemas/servers.py#n76
but in latter microversion 2.37 accidentally removed it:
http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/nova/tree/nova/api/openstack/compute/schemas/servers.py#n82

And for bdms:
the schema is added by
https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/api/openstack/compute/block_device_mapping.py#L76
and it will only work for microversion 2.32

So this function is only usable from microversion 2.32 to 2.37 for
ports and only for 2.32 for bdms.

we should fix it and backport to Newton.

Change-Id: I0e498ccc3503386b6da2f72686c7f9aa85876588
Closes-Bug: #1658571

commit_message:
Fix nova deprecated parameters

Upstream patch https://review.openstack.org/447533 removes
deprecated parameters from puppet-nova, so we need update
them in fuel-library

Change-Id: I1c5c2d86e5ac100c2635cae8ee3506d8719d56f9
Closes-Bug: #1674375
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library refs/changes/61/447561/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: let(:default_availability_zone) { Noop.puppet_function 'pick', nova_hash['default_availability_zone'], facts[:os_service_default] } let(:default_schedule_zone) { Noop.puppet_function 'pick', nova_hash['default_schedule_zone'], facts[:os_service_default] } it 'should configure availability zones' do should contain_class('nova::availability_zone').with( 'default_availability_zone' => default_availability_zone, 'default_schedule_zone' => default_schedule_zone, ) end

commit_message:
manila: install Ceph for Ubuntu trusty or xenial

When setting up Manila with CephFS in Ubuntu machines, don't
always install Ceph packages for xenial. Allow installation
of Ceph packages for trusty in Ubuntu trusty machines.

Change-Id: I70d26a3db2034331c8101795b432831718a15273
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack-plugin-ceph refs/changes/87/447287/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: * Manila with CephFS - for Ubuntu machines, only trusty or xenial versions are supported

The v1 API is still in the tree, even if it is off by
default and deprecated.  We need to keep documentation on
how it works at least until we remove the code.  This was
published to [1] which was the primary way to find this
information, and it is now missing.

This marks v1 as deprecated in the toctree.

This reverts commit 8139f7f108786112ec6eef47228ecbc7f54b6f47.

Change-Id: Ic9d0fcce5ca0f8455c212292664b8f9694edfce3
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Remove v1 API reference"

The v1 API is still in the tree, even if it is off by
default and deprecated.  We need to keep documentation on
how it works at least until we remove the code.  This was
published to [1] which was the primary way to find this
information, and it is now missing.

[1] https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/block-storage/v1/

This marks v1 as deprecated in the toctree.

This reverts commit 8139f7f108786112ec6eef47228ecbc7f54b6f47.

Change-Id: Ic9d0fcce5ca0f8455c212292664b8f9694edfce3

commit_message:
Remove old oslo.messaging transport aliases

Those are remnants from the oslo-incubator times. Also, oslo.messaging
deprecated [1] transport aliases since 5.2.0+ that is the minimal
version supported for stable/newton. The patch that bumped the minimal
version for Watcher landed 3 months+ ago, so we can proceed ripping
those aliases from the code base.

[1] I314cefa5fb1803fa7e21e3e34300e5ced31bba89

Change-Id: Ie3008cc54b0eb3d1d02f55f388bd1c3b109d126d
Closes-Bug: #1424728

commit_message:
Remove log translations

Log messages are no longer being translated. This removes all use of
the _LE, _LI, and _LW translation markers to simplify logging and to
avoid confusion with new contributions.

See:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-i18n/2016-November/002574.html
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-March/113365.html

Change-Id: I3155dceb0c9aee937cd644e67fe93c75eaa1ac2e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-openstackclient refs/changes/38/447838/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: # Translators for log levels. # # The abbreviated names are meant to reflect the usual use of a short # name like '_'. The "L" is for "log" and the other letter comes from # the level. _LI = _translators.log_info _LW = _translators.log_warning _LE = _translators.log_error _LC = _translators.log_critical

commit_message:
roles: bifrost-ironic-install: Retry failed pip installation

This is similar to commit c180998193c9 ("playbooks: roles:
bifrost-ironic-install: Retry failed PXE downloads"). Fetching
dependencies from the PYPI website may fail for various reasons
so retry installing the packages a few times before giving up.
This aims to workaround problems like the following one:

TASK [bifrost-ironic-install : Install ironic-inspector package from
pip] ******
[...]
fatal: [127.0.0.1]: FAILED! => {"changed": false, "cmd": "/bin/pip
install -U ironic-inspector", "failed": true, "invocation":
{"module_args": {"chdir": null, "editable": true, "executable": null,
"extra_args": null, "name": "ironic-inspector", "requirements": null,
"state": "latest", "umask": null, "use_mirrors": true, "version": null,
"virtualenv": "", "virtualenv_command": "virtualenv",
"virtualenv_python": null, "virtualenv_site_packages": false},
"module_name": "pip"}, "msg": "\n:stderr: Exception:
[...]
raise RetryError(e, request=request)\nRetryError:
HTTPSConnectionPool(host='pypi.python.org', port=443): Max retries
exceeded with url: /simple/ironic-inspector/ (Caused by
ResponseError('too many 503 error responses',))

Change-Id: I2a1958d661c41e3c635598c165f285b617053aad
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/bifrost refs/changes/44/447444/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: register: pip_package_install_done until: pip_package_install_done|succeeded retries: 5 delay: 10 register: pip_package_install_done until: pip_package_install_done|succeeded retries: 5 delay: 10

subject: "Event" object is not iteratable
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-21 08:46:29.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-senlinclient/commit/d38c43961fec61e059c0108a90db14c0999a4fb1', 'message': '"Event" object it not iteractable.

On master branch, this issue is triggered by the method named "take_action"
in class ListEvent(command.Lister).

With the following code, an "Event" object is returned, but this 'Event' object
is not iteratable.
events = senlin_client.events(**queries)

So, we need to turn it to a dict before
         return (columns,

                                            formatters=formatters)
                  for e in events))

that is, add the following code before "return"
events = events.to_dict()

commit_message:
"Event" object is not iteratable

On master branch, this issue is triggered by the method named "take_action"
in class ListEvent(command.Lister).

With the following code, an "Event" object is returned, but this 'Event' object
is not iteratable.
events = senlin_client.events(**queries)

So, we need to turn it to a dict before
         return (columns,
                 (utils.get_item_properties(e, columns,
                                            formatters=formatters)
                  for e in events))

that is, add the following code before "return"
events = events.to_dict()

Change-Id: Idaa2a726c1cf20cf58470368bdb13064e84e2596
Closes-Bug: 1674615
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-senlinclient refs/changes/56/447956/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: events = events.to_dict()

subject: Fix tempest-dsvm-neutron-multinode-full job VNC console settings
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-10 09:03:40.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/project-config/commit/6015d7fc01ac8c19cf70bf77a21f6a5b24cf1c75', 'message': 'Fix tempest-dsvm-neutron-multinode-full job VNC console settings

Commit https://github.com/openstack/tempest/commit/1f87a5611a added a new
tempest test "compute.servers.test_novnc.NoVNCConsoleTestJSON.test_novnc".
This test fails intermittently in multinode jobs. The test revealed that
the multinode test job has a wrong configuration.

The compute node ("subnode") in the multinode tests has a wrong value for
the config options:
* [vnc].vncserver_proxyclient_address
* [vnc].vncserver_listen
The defaults of these config options are "127.0.0.1", which makes sense in
an all-in-one test setup, but it should be the IP address of the compute node
in an multinode setup.

As the multinode test job uses a controller node (*with* compute services)
+ compute node, this also explains why this fails intermittently. The test
passes if the instance gets scheduled onto the controller node (*with*
compute service) and fails if the instance gets scheduler onto the compute
node ("subnode").

As the tempest tests and the novnc-proxy server are co-located on the
controller node, having "127.0.0.1" for "[vnc].novncproxy_base_url" is
fine(-ish). In a real-world setup this should be the IP address of the
node, where the novnc-proxy service is running (typically the controller).

The flow of commands is this:
* nova-api ask nova-compute for a valid VNC connection info object
  (with an "access_url")
* nova-consoleauth authorizes the connection info with a token
* nova-api returns the access_url + token
* a vnc client uses the access_url + token to establish a connection
* that access_url points to the nova-novncproxy service
* the nova-novncproxy service uses the token to get the connection info
  object from nova-consoleauth
* that connection info object contains the IP address of the compute node
  where the instance lives
* nova-novncproxy establishes a connection to the compute node
* the instance listens on the IP address of the compute node for incoming
  traffic

The "access_url" is derived from the config option (confusingly names)
vnc.novncproxy_base_url and the IP address the nova-novncproxy
uses is derived from the config option vnc.vncserver_proxyclient_address
Theoretically, the config option vnc.vncserver_listen could also be set
to 0.0.0.0

The important code pieces are:
* nova-api:
  https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/324768752f0a3a7e9ca14a57770556dbca419cc1/nova/compute/api.py#L3419-L3430
* nova-compute manager:
  https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/63805735c25a54ad1b9b97e05080c1a6153d8e22/nova/compute/manager.py#L4543-L4571
* The console class:
  https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/50c8f93e51fba12a154975d3d82c9cd34bc3b752/nova/console/type.py#L16-L28
* Libvirt driver:
  https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/5f16ce546f808b826fd044229f236d232141551b/nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py#L2800-L2817

Co-Authored-By: Michelle Mandel <mmandel@us.ibm.com>
Change-Id: Idfc33d838d1d83793b7d9e4bc75acd4b14e622ab
Closes-Bug: 1669468

commit_message:
Fix tempest-dsvm-neutron-multinode-full job VNC console settings

Commit https://github.com/openstack/tempest/commit/1f87a5611a added a new
tempest test "compute.servers.test_novnc.NoVNCConsoleTestJSON.test_novnc".
This test fails intermittently in multinode jobs. The test revealed that
the multinode test job has a wrong configuration.

The compute node ("subnode") in the multinode tests has a wrong value for
the config options:
* [vnc].vncserver_proxyclient_address
* [vnc].vncserver_listen
The defaults of these config options are "127.0.0.1", which makes sense in
an all-in-one test setup, but it should be the IP address of the compute node
in an multinode setup.

As the multinode test job uses a controller node (*with* compute services)
+ compute node, this also explains why this fails intermittently. The test
passes if the instance gets scheduled onto the controller node (*with*
compute service) and fails if the instance gets scheduled onto the compute
node ("subnode").

As the tempest tests and the novnc-proxy server are co-located on the
controller node, having "127.0.0.1" for "[vnc].novncproxy_base_url" is
fine(-ish). In a real-world setup this should be the IP address of the
node, where the novnc-proxy service is running (typically the controller).

The flow of commands is this:
* nova-api ask nova-compute for a valid VNC connection info object
  (with an "access_url")
* nova-consoleauth authorizes the connection info with a token
* nova-api returns the access_url + token
* a vnc client uses the access_url + token to establish a connection
* that access_url points to the nova-novncproxy service
* the nova-novncproxy service uses the token to get the connection info
  object from nova-consoleauth
* that connection info object contains the IP address of the compute node
  where the instance lives
* nova-novncproxy establishes a connection to the compute node
* the instance listens on the IP address of the compute node for incoming
  traffic

The "access_url" is derived from the config option (confusingly named)
vnc.novncproxy_base_url and the IP address the nova-novncproxy
uses is derived from the config option vnc.vncserver_proxyclient_address

The important code pieces are:
* nova-api:
  https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/324768752f0a3a7e9ca14a57770556dbca419cc1/nova/compute/api.py#L3419-L3430
* nova-compute manager:
  https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/63805735c25a54ad1b9b97e05080c1a6153d8e22/nova/compute/manager.py#L4543-L4571
* The console class:
  https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/50c8f93e51fba12a154975d3d82c9cd34bc3b752/nova/console/type.py#L16-L28
* Libvirt driver:
  https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/5f16ce546f808b826fd044229f236d232141551b/nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py#L2800-L2817

Co-Authored-By: Michelle Mandel <mmandel@us.ibm.com>
Change-Id: Idfc33d838d1d83793b7d9e4bc75acd4b14e622ab
Closes-Bug: 1669468
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/64/444164/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: export VNCSERVER_LISTEN=$HOST_IP export VNCSERVER_PROXYCLIENT_ADDRESS=$VNCSERVER_LISTEN

commit_message:
layout/tripleo: run upgrade job in tripleo-common

We found out that backward compatibility could be broken in
tripleo-common and having tripleo-upgrade-jobs would help catching them.

Let's run tripleo-upgrade-jobs in tripleo-common project.

Change-Id: I223b27b079ba00113c86e65f08e777c504c0cde9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/10/445610/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - name: tripleo-upgrade-jobs

commit_message:
layout/tripleo: remove panko from scenario002

Running scenario002 when touching Panko files is useless, we don't
deploy Panko on scenario002. It was a mistake (by me) in:
Ifdfd27957f5c363a8b32e168db8ae42f9603b7da

This patch cleans it up.

Change-Id: I989d1a279ab147e75fae5a8c06d042a19908e2a5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/35/444535/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

It turns out that our run-tox.sh scripts can't handle multiple tox envs
in the envlist. Instead of running d-g unittests under py2 and py3 in
the same job using multiple env list entries just run two jobs.

A future improvement to run tox to handle multiple envs in the envlist

commit_message:
Run separate jobs for py2 and py3 d-g unittests

It turns out that our run-tox.sh scripts can't handle multiple tox envs
in the envlist. Instead of running d-g unittests under py2 and py3 in
the same job using multiple env list entries just run two jobs.

A future improvement to run tox to handle multiple envs in the envlist
would be nice but that affects far more jobs so this is simpler for now.

Change-Id: I00a7a71133f6bd8f2ec45c4a904892979f01ad36
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/41/447641/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: envlist: run-tests publishers: - console-log - job: name: gate-devstack-gate-unittests-py3 node: ubuntu-xenial builders: - gerrit-git-prep - install-distro-packages - revoke-sudo - run-tox: envlist: py3-run-tests

commit_message:
End Project Gating for python-k8sclient

Projects that previously used python-k8sclient have
switched over to the new pypi package maintained by
the upstream kubernetes community.
https://github.com/kubernetes-incubator/client-python
https://pypi.python.org/pypi/kubernetes

So this review is the first step to shutting down
the python-k8sclient.

Please see thread in ML for a bit more context:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-February/thread.html#111980

Change-Id: I14e95e0c883eec260b31e158ce75adbc5e825863

commit_message:
Standalone Docker Machine driver for OpenStack

docker-machine folks have designed a driver API to be able
to plugin external drivers:
https://github.com/docker/machine/issues/1626

There is existing code in that repo, however driver is outdated,
we should take over that code, update to latest dependencies
(gophercloud/gophercloud), make it work with minikube etc.

Change-Id: I3fb035a39243ad135ff5513f8a8b651a5fd13970
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/86/446586/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Add monitorstack project for OpenStack-Ansible

This patch adds new pre-seeded git repository for a monitoring plugin
framework for OpenStack clouds.

This will be managed and curated by the OpenStack-Ansible core team, but
the end aim will be to move this into it's own group at a point where it
is adopted more widely.

Change-Id: I61c687a1fd89d5ac43b97a56dc1aa33cdd1528ee
Needed-By: Iadbe8ae4e205932f55907dea6931a42b63bf62e7

commit_message:
Lint Rules

Adding a tox.ini to allow lint to happen over the code.  This
also allows commits to land.  unit tests will be forthcoming
when https://github.com/juju/charm-tools/issues/249 is
resolved.

Change-Id: I8140ced05d1898f7561337e0e1f82570e0fcbcaa

commit_message:
Serialize mtu for dpdk interface with 'i40e' driver

On NIC: XL710 with driver 'i40e'  MTU does not take into
account 4 bytes VLAN tag, so we should increase it manually

DocImpact

Partial-Bug: #1587310
Co-Authored-By: Fedor Zhadaev <fzhadaev@mirantis.com>

commit_message:
Remove useless unit tests in test_l3_agent_scheduler

According to [1], only SNAT portion of dvr router is scheduled. The
get_subnet_ids_on_router method and the
_check_dvr_serviceable_ports_on_host method are not called in the
get_l3_agent_candidates method. Test cases like
test_get_l3_agent_candidates_XXXX_no_vms are no longer needed.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/254837/

Change-Id: I3c040649748e602a16ab3fbd7aca499959df61fb
Partially-Implements: blueprint improve-dvr-l3-agent-binding

commit_message:
Fix subnet service types query for sqlite3 3.7.17

_query_filter_service_subnets is returning unexpected query with
sqlite 3.7.15 - 3.7.17 versions (but working as expected for other
sqlite versions) causing "test_subnet_service_types" unit test failures.
If the query is modified like in this change, it is working as
expected on all sqlite versions.

Closes-bug: #1628996
Change-Id: Ie3c6bbf2bdbcfbe0d9b20beb470e9feddf62d05c

deleted_lines: def _query_filter_service_subnets(self, query, service_type): query = query.add_entity(ServiceType) query = query.outerjoin(ServiceType) query = query.filter(or_(ServiceType.service_type.is_(None), ServiceType.service_type == service_type)) return query.from_self(models_v2.Subnet) query = self._query_filter_service_subnets(query, service_type) query = self._query_filter_service_subnets(query, service_type)

commit_message:
[DO NOT MERGE] Enabling L3 router plugin for health checks

This commit enables health service plugin to search for health checks
specific for L3 router plugin. Any health check placed into
neutron/services/l3_router/health directory would automatically become
available to the diagnostics.

Change-Id: I8d4e444e93857ed2e2ff79b28cc980dc05760224
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/59/322159/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: [DO NOT MERGE] Sample parameterized port health check
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-27 13:03:19.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/services/l3_router/health/ping.py', 'neutron/agent/l3/health/ping.py', 'neutron/agent/dhcp/health/ping.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/7552aa923358614be4b8ffecdb8f8482e29070c4', 'message': '[DO NOT MERGE] Sample parameterized port health check

The sample health check implementation shows how to implement a health
check that calls agents via RPC and retrieves a response that is passed out
by the health service plugin.

This health check shows how a ping check would be implemented. Ports that
are exposed to tenant networks (and thus usable for ping) are the DHCP
and router ports. The check hence adds two implementations into each of
the L3 and DHCP agents (as these agents are responsible for creating
plugging the ports and placing them into appropriate namespace). The
plugin part of the check determines which agent to contact by inspecting
the port owner.

The separation of the agent and plugin parts of the health check also
show how an aggregated, more abstract parameterized check would be
implemented. It is as straightforward as to just rename the
PingHealthCheck in L3 router and
neutron/services/l3_router/health/ping.py to e.g. ReachabilityHealthCheck
and neutron/services/l3_router/health/reachability.py, and place more
logic into it. This comment is to provide further point for discussion of
Alternatives 1 and 2 at [1].

The health check is made available by plain placing its implementation
into appropriate directories (see previous commits for details on health
check discovery).

Please note that the logic does not actually perform the ping as this is
not relevant to the sample. It also returns a plain text instead of a
more appropriate structured response but again, this is a minor issue not
significant to understand the idea of how to implement the health check.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/308973

Change-Id: I8ba3a3abfb0e843558680d8b0f5e869dffac4226
'}]
commit_message:
[DO NOT MERGE] Sample parameterized port health check

The sample health check implementation shows how to implement a health
check that calls agents via RPC and retrieves a response that is passed out
by the health service plugin.

This health check shows how a ping check would be implemented. Ports that
are exposed to tenant networks (and thus usable for ping) are the DHCP
and router ports. The check hence adds two implementations into each of
the L3 and DHCP agents (as these agents are responsible for creating
plugging the ports and placing them into appropriate namespace). The
plugin part of the check determines which agent to contact by inspecting
the port owner.

The separation of the agent and plugin parts of the health check also
show how an aggregated, more abstract parameterized check would be
implemented. It is as straightforward as to just rename the
PingHealthCheck in L3 router and
neutron/services/l3_router/health/ping.py to e.g. ReachabilityHealthCheck
and neutron/services/l3_router/health/reachability.py, and place more
logic into it. This comment is to provide further point for discussion of
Alternatives 1 and 2 at [1].

The health check is made available by plain placing its implementation
into appropriate directories (see previous commits for details on health
check discovery).

Please note that the logic does not actually perform the ping as this is
not relevant to the sample. It also returns a plain text instead of a
more appropriate structured response but again, this is a minor issue not
significant to understand the idea of how to implement the health check.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/308973

Change-Id: I8ba3a3abfb0e843558680d8b0f5e869dffac4226

commit_message:
[DO NOT MERGE] Health check base for agent implementations

This commit adds base classes for both agent and implementations of
agent-side of health checks.

Each health check implementation at the agent side has to inherit from
HealthCheckBaseInAgent class.

The HealthCheckingAgentMixin class provides a mixin for use in agents
that provide health checking capabilities. It provides methods for
subscribing to appropriate queues and handling health check execution
requests. Upon initialization, agent code has to call
health_check_initialize() method that enumerates available health checks
and subscribes to appropriate messaging topics. The actual health message
handling needs to be started by invoking health_check_start_consuming()
method after agent is itself initialized and ready for handling these
requests.

Change-Id: Iea6f4895ca557125c34d026b75608296512fdd3e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/60/322160/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright 2016 OpenStack Foundation # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import abc import inspect import os import six from oslo_log import log as logging from neutron._i18n import _LI, _LW from neutron.agent import rpc as agent_rpc from neutron.common import health as common_health LOG = logging.getLogger(__name__) class HealthCheckBaseInAgent(object): ''' Base class for agent-side implementation of a health check. ''' name = None topics = {} def get_name(self): """ Returns a unique name of this check, e.g. "trace_route". The name must only conform to syntax of Python identifier (only composed of English letters, digits, and underscores). Child classes are encouraged to set value of "name" property instead of overriding this method. """ return self.name or self.__class__.__name__ def get_topics(self): """ Returns a map of messaging topics where the check is invoked from. The topics of all available checks are gathered by the controller and the controller then subscribes to consuming these topics. The key of the map is main topic, the value is array of pairs of subtopics, e.g.: {topics.DHCP_AGENT: [(topics.PORT, topics.HEALTH)]} The key and value match prefix and topic_details parameters of the neutron.agent.rpc.create_consumers() function. Child classes are encouraged to set value of "topics" property instead of overriding this method. """ return self.topics @abc.abstractmethod def execute(self, context, agent, resource_id, **kwargs): """ Executes the actual check and returns its result. :param context: RPC call context :param agent: Reference to the agent :param resource_id: ID of the resource if the check was requested for a specific resource, otherwise None :param kwargs: Additional arguments :return: Check result (a HealthCheckResult object) """ pass class HealthCheckingAgentMixin(object): ''' Agent-side implemenation that enables agent to process RPC health check requests. Typical usage by agents is by inheriting this mixin, initializing the mixin by calling health_check_initialize() method in the class initializer, and starting the RPC call responder after initialization completes by invoking health_check_start_consuming() method. ''' available_health_checks = {} def health_check_initialize(self, check_paths=None): ''' Initializes health check agent subsystem, namely loads health checks from the given paths and subscribes to health messaging topics relevant to the available health checks. :param check_paths: List of paths where the health check class files are searched for. If not given, it is "health" subdirectory of the directory containing declaration of the class that inherits this mixin. ''' if check_paths is None: check_paths = [ os.path.dirname(inspect.getfile(self.__class__)) + os.sep + common_health.HEALTH_CHECKS_SEARCH_SUBPATH] LOG.debug("Loading health checks from %s", check_paths) checks = common_health.load_health_checks(check_paths) map(self.register_check, checks) # Get a set of unique topic details from available checks # so that each is subscribed just once topic_details = {} for c in self.available_health_checks.values(): if not c.get_topics(): LOG.warning(_LW("Check %s will not be available as it does " "not subscribe to any topics."), c.get_name()) continue for topic, subtopics in six.iteritems(c.get_topics()): s = topic_details.setdefault(topic, set()) s.update([tuple(st) for st in subtopics]) LOG.debug("Subscribing to: %s", topic_details) self.health_connections = [agent_rpc.create_consumers( [self], topic, subtopics, start_listening=False) for topic, subtopics in six.iteritems(topic_details)] def health_check_start_consuming(self): """ Starts responding to the health check requests from the message queue. :return: """ for h in self.health_connections: h.consume_in_threads() def health_check(self, context, check_name=None, check_args=None, **kwargs): """ RPC-called procedure that executes the requested health check and returns its result. :param context: RPC context :param check_name: Name of the check :param check_args: Named arguments passed to the check :return: Result of the check """ LOG.debug("Check: %s, check_args: %s, kwargs: %s", check_name, check_args, kwargs) # TODO(hmlnarik) verify request came from appropriate message queue check = self.available_health_checks.get(check_name) if not check: raise Exception("Unknown check: %s" % check_name) if check_args is None: check_args = {} return check.execute(context, self, **check_args) @staticmethod def _verify_health_check(check): """Checks for required methods in health check objects.""" return isinstance(check, HealthCheckBaseInAgent) # TODO(hmlnarik): register per check topic, currently all checks are # put into a single dict def register_check(self, check): if self._verify_health_check(check): LOG.info(_LI("Registering health check %s"), check.get_name()) self.available_health_checks[check.get_name()] = check else: LOG.warning(_LW("Class %s is not a valid health check"), check.__class__.__name__)

commit_message:
Flush the mac address of port during PCI-PT VM deletion.

The mac address of the direct-physical neutron port
should be flushed and should be assigned with a
randomly generated mac address after the
VM associated with that port is deleted.

Change-Id: Ib64761de54ecf6e93a02551c2e9f830b06da712d
Closes-Bug: #1607369
Co-Authored-By: Raghuveer Shenoy <rshenoy@hp.com>
Co-Authored-By: Sonu <sonu.sudhakaran@gmail.com>

added_lines: import re from neutron.api.v2 import attributes from neutron.db import db_base_plugin_v2 def _is_mac_update_allowed(self, port): vif_type = port.get(portbindings.VIF_TYPE) if (vif_type == portbindings.VIF_TYPE_UNBOUND): base_mac = cfg.CONF.base_mac.split(':') base_mac = base_mac[0] + ':' + base_mac[1] mac_match = re.match( base_mac, port.get('mac_address'), re.IGNORECASE) if not (mac_match or bool(port.get(portbindings.PROFILE, None))): return True return False def update_port_postcommit(self, context): port = context.current port_id = port['id'] vnic_type = port.get(portbindings.VNIC_TYPE) if (vnic_type == portbindings.VNIC_DIRECT_PHYSICAL): if (self._is_mac_update_allowed(port)): new_mac = ( db_base_plugin_v2.NeutronDbPluginV2._generate_mac()) port['mac_address'] = new_mac db_base_plugin_v2.NeutronDbPluginV2().update_port( context._plugin_context, port_id, {attributes.PORT: port})

commit_message:
Implement '-F' option for 'net-ip-availability-*' command respond

In respond to 'net-ip-availability-list' and 'net-ip-availability-show'
commands, follow the '-F' or '--field' option when present

Change-Id: I246e6e5999209e189c4207cf3b10c6c476936554
Closes-Bug: #1586908
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/68/323168/10 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: net_ip_availabilities = super(NetworkIPAvailabilityPlugin, return [self._fields(ip_availability, fields) for ip_availability in net_ip_availabilities]

subject: Rewrite ip_lib to use oslo.privsep/pyroute2
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-02-13 04:00:06.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/c9650c51d634909612a1204c5599db023fa2a6e5', 'message': 'Introduce privilege separation process

This change introduces a "privsep" process that runs with a limited set
of elevated Linux capabilities (NET_ADMIN,SYS_ADMIN as written), and
proxies privileged commands on behalf of the peer process.

The interface between the two processes is over a private (AF_UNIX)
socket pair and the serialisation protocol is deliberately limited for
ease of auditing (in particular no complex objects).

The key externally visible change is that the original process now needs
to be started as root (or already with the required set of privileges),
since sudo is no longer used to gain elevated permissions.

This change demonstrates how to use the process by adapting the
ovs_neutron_agent.main() to start the privsep daemon, and converts
ip_lib and ipset to take advantage of the new sudo-less environment.

TODO: testing :)
TODO: start daemon from every main() where privileged operations may be
      required.
TODO: devstack/documentation changes to start as root

Change-Id: Ie176358e3dcfd85cf5d9a4b6235dc41246ef8e5d

'}, {'number': 6, 'created': '2015-05-14 07:39:40.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/831b4854ae864da0385e9b2f991ec896d695ed41', 'message': 'Introduce privilege separation process

This change introduces a "privsep" process that runs with a limited set
of elevated Linux capabilities (NET_ADMIN,SYS_ADMIN as written), and
proxies privileged commands on behalf of the peer process.

The interface between the two processes is over a private (AF_UNIX)
socket pair and the serialisation protocol is deliberately limited for
ease of auditing (in particular no complex objects).

Different alternatives to starting the privsep process are provided:
- The default starts privsep on demand via sudo or rootwrap and is
  compatible with existing deployment approaches
- An explicit call early in main() and before dropping privileges
  (This latter follows the traditional (non-sudo) Unix daemon model)

This change demonstrates how to use the process by converting ip_lib and
ipset to take advantage of the new sudo-less environment.  There's also
a straightforward rootwrap-daemon wrapper for backwards compatibility.

Change-Id: Ie176358e3dcfd85cf5d9a4b6235dc41246ef8e5d
Depends-On: I6232de1b1dc18944d1b6e02a6e6e05dd1680100f
Depends-On: Id647a4f509285c873cc32dbb5dcdecc124df29ed

'}, {'number': 15, 'created': '2016-04-19 05:52:24.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/97321a872332ff260dc49a56359cddd18c8e82cb', 'message': 'Rewrite ip_lib to use oslo.privsep/pyroute2

Reimplement ip_lib.py on top of pyroute2 via oslo.privsep.

This means we talk to the kernel directly via netlink, so we avoid the
overhead of generating/parsing/executing iproute commands, version skew
in iproute output, and rely less on sudo.

Change-Id: Ie176358e3dcfd85cf5d9a4b6235dc41246ef8e5d
Depends-On: Ia9675dff9232e0e987a836ecaf9e842eb5c3cb18

commit_message:
Rewrite ip_lib to use oslo.privsep/pyroute2

Reimplement ip_lib.py on top of pyroute2 via oslo.privsep.

This means we talk to the kernel directly via netlink, so we avoid the
overhead of generating/parsing/executing iproute commands, version skew
in iproute output, and rely less on sudo.

Change-Id: Ie176358e3dcfd85cf5d9a4b6235dc41246ef8e5d
Closes-bug: 1492714

added_lines: # Copyright 2015 Rackspace, Inc. # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import atexit import errno import sys import pyroute2 from neutron.openstack.common import log as logging LOG = logging.getLogger(__name__) # TODO(gus): push this upstream (to either eventlet or pyroute2) def _maybe_monkeypatch_pyroute2_for_eventlet(): eventlet = sys.modules.get('eventlet', None) if (eventlet is None or eventlet.patcher.is_monkey_patched('multiprocessing')): return import socket import multiprocessing import cPickle as pickle class MyMpConnection(object): def __init__(self, sock): sock.setblocking(True) self.sock = sock def fileno(self): return self.sock.fileno() def send(self, obj): pickle.dump(obj, self, protocol=-1) def write(self, s): self.sock.sendall(s) def recv(self): return pickle.load(self) def read(self, n): return self.sock.recv(n) def readline(self): buf = b'' c = None while c != '\n': c = self.sock.recv(1) buf += c return buf class MyMultiprocessing(object): """Highly limited multiprocessing reimplementation.""" @staticmethod def Pipe(): s1, s2 = socket.socketpair() return (MyMpConnection(s1), MyMpConnection(s2)) Process = multiprocessing.Process LOG.info('Monkey-patching pyroute2.netns.mp for eventlet support') pyroute2.netns.mp = MyMultiprocessing _maybe_monkeypatch_pyroute2_for_eventlet() _ipdb_singletons = {} def _ipdb(ns=None): try: ipdb = _ipdb_singletons[ns] except KeyError: nl = pyroute2.NetNS(ns) if ns is not None else None ipdb = pyroute2.IPDB(mode='explicit', nl=nl) _ipdb_singletons[ns] = ipdb return ipdb @atexit.register def _close_ipdb(): for ip in _ipdb_singletons.values(): ip.release() def GetLinkList(ns=None): ipdb = _ipdb(ns=ns) return ipdb.by_name.keys() def GetLinkAttrs(link_name, ns=None): ipdb = _ipdb(ns=ns) return ipdb.by_name[link_name] def UpdateLinkAttrs(link_name, attrs, ns=None): ipdb = _ipdb(ns=ns) iface = ipdb.by_name[link_name] iface.begin() for k, v in attrs: iface[k] = v iface.commit() def CreateLink(kind, name, ns=None, **kwargs): ipdb = _ipdb(ns=ns) iface = ipdb.create(ifname=name, kind=kind, **kwargs) iface.commit() def DeleteLink(name, ns=None): ipdb = _ipdb(ns=ns) iface = ipdb.by_name[name] iface.begin() iface.remove() iface.commit() def SetLinkUp(name, up, ns=None): ipdb = _ipdb(ns=ns) iface = ipdb.by_name[name] iface.begin() if up: iface.up() else: iface.down() iface.commit() def CreateNetns(name, ignore_exists=False): try: pyroute2.netns.create(name) except OSError as e: if not (ignore_exists and e.errno == errno.EEXIST): raise def GetNetnsList(): return pyroute2.netns.listnetns() def DeleteNetns(name): ipdb = _ipdb_singletons.get(name, None) if ipdb is not None: ipdb.release() ipdb = None del _ipdb_singletons[name] pyroute2.netns.remove()

commit_message:
Add check that external gw port exist in metering-agent

The check is needed when following rpc is called.
This patch adds 2 & 3.
Check for 1 had already added in [1].
[1] f73dae0a65a6b63cffae5c5e3c2f98d4f0e35ccf
1. add_metering_label(create a meter label).
2. add_metering_label_rule(create a meter label rule).
3. remove_metering_label_rule(delete a meter label rule).

Change-Id: I9cfd16253e65328ebf7f45b1e052b56170cc2150
Closes-bug: #1622574

commit_message:
Make Zaqar Swift gate voting

This turns voting on for the Zaqar tempest job using the Swift backend,
as it's now green, and put it in the gate.

commit_message:
Add corner case testing to address scope OVO access.

For get_address_scopes and get_address_scopes_count, filters parameter
is by default set to None. Filters are then passed to AddressScope OVO
with **, if they are not be set to emty dict, the exception would be
raised. Added empty dictionary assignment if filters are not set.
Added validate_filters=False to above methods, because API allows to pass
arbitrary strings as filtering arguments.

Tenant_id can be passed for filtering, when passing validate_filters=False.
This would be translated to project_id at SQLAlchemy level.

Change-Id: I80f153609451a321ca9024c07ef642834c60158a
Partially-Implements: blueprint adopt-oslo-versioned-objects-for-db

commit_message:
ovsfw: Cleanup *_port_filter methods

{prepare,update}_port_filter are mostly the same, so merge them.
Also, make use of new get_ofport functionality to
simplify remove_port_filter.

Change-Id: Ia7db44810249e3da970afc55e3d465e39ea3dcb3
