commit_message:
[ci][Rally] Add VMTask scenario

VMTasks.boot_runcommand_delete scenario boots VM with attached network
interface, injects a file and launch it over ssh.

This scenario has a big failure rate at Rally upstream CI. Most of failures
relates to SSHTimeout and ConnectTimeout(from neutronclient).

Change-Id: I7f8b4868b14701b5dcbcf77bc2f01d54fe225a92
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/04/425704/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: VMTasks.boot_runcommand_delete: - args: flavor: name: "m1.tiny" image: name: "^cirros.*uec$" command: # this file will be injected and launched via ssh script_file: "~/.rally/extra/instance_test.sh" interpreter: "/bin/sh" username: "cirros" runner: type: "constant" times: 9 concurrency: 3 context: users: tenants: 2 users_per_tenant: 2 network: {} sla: failure_rate: max: 0

subject: Fix dhcp_ready_on_ports causing race with ovs agent boot
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-21 08:36:11.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/api/rpc/handlers/dhcp_rpc.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/api/rpc/handlers/test_dhcp_rpc.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/2f8380cbe5eab77cf11d482d56fa76108d522c6a', 'message': 'Fix dhcp_ready_on_ports causing race with ovs agent boot

When neutron-openvswitch-agent starts it indirectly causes all the ports
it has to transition into BUILD status. This in turn causes dhcp agent
to send dhcp_ready_on_ports when it has done its business.

Unfortunately dhcp_ready_on_ports also causes the port in BUILD status
to transition into ACTIVE thus causing l2pop fdb entries to be emitted
way to soon. When OVS agent finally calls update_device_list the ports
are already in ACTIVE state and no fdb entries are emitted. The OVS
agent is left in an inconsistent state with lots of fdb entries missing.

The workaround for now is not to call provisioning_complete from
dhcp_ready_on_ports when there are no provisioning blocks for a given
resource.

Change-Id: I168b3483ca045ec2f50ad1aa2314fb4284243802
Closes-Bug: #1651672
'}]
commit_message:
Fix dhcp_ready_on_ports causing race with ovs agent boot

When neutron-openvswitch-agent starts it indirectly causes all the ports
it has to transition into BUILD status. This in turn causes dhcp agent
to send dhcp_ready_on_ports when it has done its business.

Unfortunately dhcp_ready_on_ports also causes the port in BUILD status
to transition into ACTIVE thus causing l2pop fdb entries to be emitted
way to soon. When OVS agent finally calls update_device_list the ports
are already in ACTIVE state and no fdb entries are emitted. The OVS
agent is left in an inconsistent state with lots of fdb entries missing.

The workaround for now is not to call provisioning_complete from
dhcp_ready_on_ports when there are no provisioning blocks for a given
resource.

Change-Id: I168b3483ca045ec2f50ad1aa2314fb4284243802
Closes-Bug: #1651672
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/00/413500/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_dhcp_ready_on_ports_no_blocks(self): context = mock.Mock() with mock.patch.object(provisioning_blocks, 'is_object_blocked') as is_blocked: is_blocked.return_value = False port_ids = range(10) with mock.patch.object(provisioning_blocks, 'provisioning_complete') as pc: self.callbacks.dhcp_ready_on_ports(context, port_ids) self.assertTrue(pc.call_count == 0)

commit_message:
Externalize Attr Base Check and OwnerCheck

On 'get' and 'delete', attr checks are ignored, but the returned
object list is iterated over anyhow.  This externalizes this
check so that each object is not iterated over and completes
an overall action check against the first item in the returned
object list, if OwnerCheck is detected in an OrCheck policy tree.
This reduces the response time to half of what it is currently
for both the API and OSC on large get responses.

Change-Id: I9bbd6c862c6d44e8d5ace7873c0c3932f4788086
Closes-bug: #1611626

commit_message:
Change rules in firewall policy would not always set 'audited' to False.

The value of 'audited' attribute can be set to True or False when users
create a firewall policy. It shoudn't be set to False automatically when
a user insert or remove a rule to this firewall policy if it has been
explicitly set when firewall policy was created.
The 'audited' attribute only can be set to False automaticaly
when it hasn't been set when the firewall policy was created.

Change-Id: I830d3052b00e8a79081453eca9a69ab137afd76f
Partial-Bug: 1656735

commit_message:
[WIP] QoS NIC bandwidth manager for Linux Bridge backend

Implements a bandwith manager for QoS plugin. This
bandwidth manager captures the total bandwidth
available in the physical NICs and increases or
decreases this quantity depending on the Neutron
ports QoS minimum bandwidth requirements.

TODO:
 - Unit tests

Related-Bug: #1578989
Change-Id: I6114de5d69c422eebdbcfa990d0df1ba9669339f

commit_message:
Include switch id in result of switch query

get_all_logical_switches_with_ports should return
both the name and id of the logical switch.
This is needed as tools such as the ovirt provider
for ovn will use id's for relations between
entities.

Change-Id: I674484f460affc93744f0f896f6edf9fe7a0f1e4
Signed-off-by: Marcin Mirecki<mmirecki@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Don't override rpc workers when set to 0

Patch stops setting rpc_workers config value to 1 if it's < 1. Previous
behavior made impossible to run neutron-server as a single process which
makes it hard to work with debugger.

Change-Id: Ib9c785d6d4e008413c02e1b2394a8e918534e657
Closes-bug: 1609863

commit_message:
Tempest: Enable creation of setup with provided port type

If tempest.conf file has port_vnic_type field, then the network
for the setup will be created with port of a given type
For example for SRIOV setup the conf file will have the value
of direct or direct-physical for port_vnic_type field

Change-Id: I178811516537d4ba183cffd7d09ceb69650e07a1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/36/422536/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: Add FIP status change notifications
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-21 20:27:02.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/9a4069c127d67ab6c1c8f4bacc9ad57190ebc3f8', 'message': 'Add FIP status change notifications

This patch adds FIP status change notifications via neutron
callbacks in preparation for a callback subscriber that will
publish the FIP status changes to the notification queue.
The handler that publishes notifications will come in a
follow-on patch.

Rather than use the existing notification event BEFORE_UPDATE
this patch adds BEFORE_STATUS_UPDATE to indicate only a
simple status change is happening. This allows consumers
that wish to subscribe strictly to full-blown FIP updates to
do so via BEFORE_UPDATE separately from status updates.

Finally, unit tests are included in this patch to verify the respective
functionality.

Partial-Bug: #1593793

Change-Id: I154ee31eebbc0f130a9301ba539cd0cab46b73f5
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-07-22 15:21:28.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/78db96fa73050255caa4720e4a05c4156a14197d', 'message': "Add FIP status change notifications

This patch adds FIP status change notifications via neutron
callbacks in preparation for a callback subscriber that will
publish the FIP status changes to the notification queue.
The handler that publishes notifications will come in a
follow-on patch.

The FIP status update notification uses the PRECOMMIT_UPDATE
event and thus models its payload after existing usages of such [1].
 PRECOMMIT_UPDATE is chosen for the following reasons:
- update_floatingip_status() is called in a consumer's transaction
and therefore the actual status update is not yet committed at the
time of this notification. Therefore PRECOMMIT seems more proper.
While we could impl AFTER_UPDATE in consumer's code, it's better IMO
to handle the notification at the (single) source; here in l3_db.
- Existing AFTER_UPDATE notifications for FIPs [2] build a substantial
payload. While we could build that payload for this status update, the
overhead in doing so seems unwarranted. Since PRECOMMIT_UPDATE
is not yet used, we can use an 'easier' payload format to reduce
such overhead.

Finally, unit tests are included in this patch to verify the respective
functionality.

[1] https://goo.gl/YluCTF
[2] https://goo.gl/W4FAiu

Partial-Bug: #1593793

Change-Id: I154ee31eebbc0f130a9301ba539cd0cab46b73f5
"}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2016-08-01 22:03:51.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/4b12e7f8ebae1f682346fc73d75accf60d940cc5', 'message': "Add FIP status change notifications

This patch adds FIP status change notifications via neutron
callbacks in preparation for a callback subscriber that will
publish the FIP status changes to the notification queue.
The handler that publishes notifications will come in a
follow-on patch.

The FIP status update notification uses the AFTER_UPDATE
event and thus models its payload after existing usages of such [1].
To support proper AFTER_UPDATE semantics, consumers holding
the transaction for the FIP status update are responsible for
invoking notify() on the callback registry post-commit. To support
consumer's notify() responsibility, update_floatingip_status() returns
a dict payload that can be used for the notification if an update is made.
This keeps the logic to build the payload encapsulated within l3_db.

Finally, unit tests are included in this patch to verify the respective
functionality.

[1] https://goo.gl/YluCTF
[2] https://goo.gl/W4FAiu

commit_message:
Add FIP status change notifications

This patch adds FIP status change notifications via neutron
callbacks in preparation for a callback subscriber that will
publish the FIP status changes to the notification queue.
The handler that publishes notifications will come in a
follow-on patch.

The FIP status update notification uses the AFTER_UPDATE
event and thus models its payload after existing usages of such [1].
To support proper AFTER_UPDATE semantics, consumers holding
the transaction for the FIP status update are responsible for
invoking notify() on the callback registry post-commit. To support
consumer's notify() responsibility, update_floatingip_status() returns
a dict payload that can be used for the notification if an update is made.
This keeps the logic to build the payload encapsulated within l3_db.

Finally, unit tests are included in this patch to verify the respective
functionality.

[1] https://goo.gl/YluCTF
[2] https://goo.gl/W4FAiu

Partial-Bug: #1593793

Change-Id: I154ee31eebbc0f130a9301ba539cd0cab46b73f5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/54/345654/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_update_floatingip_status_changed(self): mock_query, mock_obj = mock.Mock(), mock.Mock() mock_obj.one.return_value = {'status': 'ACTIVE'} mock_query().filter.return_value = mock_obj setattr(self.db, '_model_query', mock_query) mock_context = mock.Mock() with mock.patch.object(l3_db.registry, 'notify') as mock_notify: self.db.update_floatingip_status(mock_context, 'fip-1', 'DOWN') mock_notify.assert_called_once_with( 'floating_ip', 'before_status_update', self.db, context=mock_context, fip={'status': 'ACTIVE'}, new_status='DOWN', old_status='ACTIVE') mock_obj.update.assert_called_once_with( {'status': 'DOWN'}, synchronize_session=False) def test_update_floatingip_status_unchanged(self): mock_query, mock_obj = mock.Mock(), mock.Mock() mock_obj.one.return_value = {'status': 'ACTIVE'} mock_query().filter.return_value = mock_obj setattr(self.db, '_model_query', mock_query) mock_context = mock.Mock() with mock.patch.object(l3_db.registry, 'notify') as mock_notify: self.db.update_floatingip_status(mock_context, 'fip-1', 'ACTIVE') self.assertEqual([], mock_notify.mock_calls) mock_obj.update.assert_called_once_with( {'status': 'ACTIVE'}, synchronize_session=False)

commit_message:
neutron-ovs-agent: Avoid importing Linux specific modules on Windows

The neutron-ovs-agent service fails to start on Windows due to a few
Linux specific imports. This addresses this issue.

Closes-Bug: #1661326

Change-Id: Ia8549b1c06892430d6962a91e2b3c02b58d5e026

commit_message:
Support query with sort-key from standardattr

This patch support for quering core resource if user input sort-key from
standard_attrs table. Like created_at and so on.

Currently, oslo_db function paginate_query is not very good support
combination query with marker, I introduce a fix about this.
I727aafc1b6566808622a5c9a9e5a574ceb51ee97

Change-Id: I1b58bbd82f900bce53573416a6da322adba93895
Partial-Bug: #1659175
Depends-On: Icfeab12b2317e3d186e0ce585a5de08b8d5b0bc7
Depends-On: I727aafc1b6566808622a5c9a9e5a574ceb51ee97
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/49/424949/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import sqlalchemyfrom neutron.db import standard_attr as sattrs for sort_key, sort_dir in zip(sort_keys, sort_dirs): if sort_key in ['description', 'created_at', 'updated_at', 'revision_number']: collection = sa_utils.paginate_query( collection, sattrs.StandardAttribute, None, marker=marker_obj, sort_keys=[sort_key], sort_dirs=[sort_dir]) else: collection = sa_utils.paginate_query( collection, model, None, marker=marker_obj, sort_keys=[sort_key], sort_dirs=[sort_dir]) sort_keys_add = [] sort_dirs_add = [] sort_keys_add.append(k) sort_dirs_add.append('asc') collection = sa_utils.paginate_query(collection, model, limit, marker=marker_obj, sort_keys=sort_keys_add, sort_dirs=sort_dirs_add)
deleted_lines: sort_keys.append(k) sort_dirs.append('asc') collection = sa_utils.paginate_query(collection, model, limit, marker=marker_obj, sort_keys=sort_keys, sort_dirs=sort_dirs)

commit_message:
Remove side-effect from config module

Importing neutron.common.config module has a side-effect that cli_opts
are registered. This doesn't work in case module, or any other module
importing this config module, is imported in in-tree tempest tests due
to tempest bug 1592345.

This patch registeres CLI opts explicitly only for Neutron executables.

Related-bug: #1592345

Change-Id: I89017d2d97dcc5419a4039353e6efa5cc7e9995b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/58/431158/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: common_config.register_common_conf_opts(cfg.CONF)

subject: IPtables enhancement for co-existence of SG and FWaaS v2 drivers
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-28 08:52:59.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/3ae93177f121193c7136e2e68451e4f68d5f4c63', 'message': 'The Iptables manager and firewall driver in Neutron must be enhanced for
co-existence of SecurityGroup and FWaaS v2 APIs.  This patch re-factors
the IPTables driver for enabling FWaaS and SG chain to be interleaved
preserving ordering of rules.

Change-Id: I690d8e69a34294a99997abbc4e1b749515c2700b
Closes-Bug: #1607227
Co-Authored-By: Sarath Chandra Mekala <mekala.sarath@gmail.com>
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-08-12 03:00:30.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/47920fded5a02cab4d45695015153430697019e7', 'message': 'The Iptables manager and firewall driver in Neutron must be enhanced for
co-existence of SecurityGroup and FWaaS v2 APIs.  This patch re-factors
the IPTables driver for enabling FWaaS and SG chain to be interleaved
preserving ordering of rules.

Partial-Implements: blueprint fwaas-api-2.0

Co-Authored-By: Chandan Dutta Chowdhury <chandanc@juniper.net>
Co-Authored-By: Sarath Chandra Mekala <mekala.sarath@gmail.com>

Change-Id: I690d8e69a34294a99997abbc4e1b749515c2700b
'}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2016-08-16 09:52:33.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/fb4fff58c5354d95624241e116541455549f1ced', 'message': 'IPtables enhancement for co-existence of SG and FWaaS v2 drivers

FwaaS V2 will manage both L3 and L2 ports. While managing the L2 ports
it has to co-exist with SG rules. This patch enhances IPTables manager
to solves the problem of rule contention and ordering by creating
common intermediary chains for the filter table.

All packets in the filter table are redirected to this common
intermediary chain which forms the common jump point for
redirecting traffic to the SG and FWaaS specific chains. These chains
are used by SG and FwaaS drivers for populating interface specific rules.
Once the packets are filtered by both SG and FWaaS chains they are sent
to an intermediary accept chain where the packets are matched against
SG and FWaaS accept rules.

You can refer to the following google doc for the discussion leading
to this design:

https://docs.google.com/document/d/1yGsGwVNZuptPCzMMgBH4AHVkdoeWvQxsT5Wql7-jtHI/edit?usp=sharing

Partial-Implements: blueprint fwaas-api-2.0

Co-Authored-By: Chandan Dutta Chowdhury <chandanc@juniper.net>
Co-Authored-By: Sarath Chandra Mekala <mekala.sarath@gmail.com>

Change-Id: I690d8e69a34294a99997abbc4e1b749515c2700b

'}, {'number': 6, 'created': '2016-10-04 10:08:02.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/9bdc9a72799186f6f456fdb9d330879c573a9992', 'message': 'IPtables enhancement for co-existence of SG and FWaaS v2 drivers

FwaaS V2 will manage both L3 and L2 ports. While managing the L2 ports
it has to co-exist with SG rules. This patch enhances IPTables manager
to solves the problem of rule contention and ordering by creating
common intermediary chains for the filter table.

All packets in the filter table are redirected to this common
intermediary chain which forms the common jump point for
redirecting traffic to the SG and FWaaS specific chains. These chains
are used by SG and FwaaS drivers for populating interface specific rules.
Once the packets are filtered by both SG and FWaaS chains they are sent
to an intermediary accept chain where the packets are matched against
SG and FWaaS accept rules.

You can refer to the following google doc for the discussion leading
to this design:

https://docs.google.com/document/d/1yGsGwVNZuptPCzMMgBH4AHVkdoeWvQxsT5Wql7-jtHI/edit?usp=sharing

Partial-Implements: blueprint fwaas-api-2.0

Co-Authored-By: Chandan Dutta Chowdhury <chandanc@juniper.net>
Co-Authored-By: Sarath Chandra Mekala <mekala.sarath@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Nate Johnston <Nate_Johnston@cable.comcast.com>

Change-Id: I690d8e69a34294a99997abbc4e1b749515c2700b

it has to co-exist with SG rules. This patch enhances IPTables manager
to solves the problem of rule contention and ordering by creating
common intermediary chains for the filter table.

All packets in the filter table are redirected to this common
intermediary chain which forms the common jump point for
redirecting traffic to the SG and FWaaS specific chains. These chains
are used by SG and FwaaS drivers for populating interface specific rules.
Once the packets are filtered by both SG and FWaaS chains they are sent
to an intermediary accept chain where the packets are matched against
SG and FWaaS accept rules.

You can refer to the following google doc for the discussion leading
to this design:

https://docs.google.com/document/d/1yGsGwVNZuptPCzMMgBH4AHVkdoeWvQxsT5Wql7-jtHI/edit?usp=sharing

Partial-Implements: blueprint fwaas-api-2.0

commit_message:
IPtables enhancement for co-existence of SG and FWaaS v2 drivers

FwaaS V2 will manage both L3 and L2 ports. While managing the L2 ports
it has to co-exist with SG rules. This patch enhances IPTables manager
to solve the problem of rule contention and ordering by creating
common intermediary chains for the filter table.

All packets in the filter table are redirected to this common
intermediary chain which forms the common jump point for
redirecting traffic to the SG and FWaaS specific chains. These chains
are used by SG and FwaaS drivers for populating interface specific rules.
Once the packets are filtered by both SG and FWaaS chains they are sent
to an intermediary accept chain where the packets are matched against
SG and FWaaS accept rules.

You can refer to the following google doc for the discussion leading
to this design:

https://docs.google.com/document/d/1yGsGwVNZuptPCzMMgBH4AHVkdoeWvQxsT5Wql7-jtHI/edit?usp=sharing

Partial-Implements: blueprint fwaas-api-2.0

Co-Authored-By: Chandan Dutta Chowdhury <chandanc@juniper.net>
Co-Authored-By: Sarath Chandra Mekala <mekala.sarath@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Nate Johnston <Nate_Johnston@cable.comcast.com>

Change-Id: I690d8e69a34294a99997abbc4e1b749515c2700b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/77/348177/32 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # FWaaS v2.0 Changes # Common Chains with ordering tables['filter'].add_chain('ACCEPT') tables['filter'].add_rule('FORWARD', '-j $FORWARD', wrap=False) tables['filter'].add_rule('FORWARD', '-j $ACCEPT', wrap=False) filter_chains = ['INPUT', 'FORWARD', 'OUTPUT', 'ACCEPT'] filter_components = ['sg', 'fw'] for f_chain in filter_chains: for f_comp in filter_components: chain_name = 'neutron-%s-%s' % (f_comp, f_chain) tables['filter'].add_chain(chain_name, wrap=False) tables['filter'].add_rule(f_chain, '-j %s' % chain_name) if '-sg-' in chain or '-fw-' in chain:

subject: Update KillFilter for OpenStack on RHEL
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-13 22:07:44.000000000', 'files': ['etc/neutron/rootwrap.d/dhcp.filters', 'etc/neutron/rootwrap.d/l3.filters'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/d7f80db7991add288172f28524101d8c57e805f0', 'message': 'Update KillFilter for OpenStack on RHEL

At the moment, the OpenStack RHEL packages are built with the
she-bang line pointing towards /usr/bin/python2 which is a symlink
to /usr/bin/python2.7.  This causes problems with rootwrap not
being able to kill processes as it fails to find a matching process.

This patch address that issue by adding that extra path to prevent
this issue from occuring.  This is problematic because it spams the
logs when periodic tasks run and try to kill process non-stop but
are blocked by rootwrap.

Change-Id: If97512a512603cb2dc548541c63d5c8dde527963
'}]
commit_message:
Update KillFilter for OpenStack on RHEL

At the moment, the OpenStack RHEL packages are built with the
she-bang line pointing towards /usr/bin/python2 which is a symlink
to /usr/bin/python2.7.  This causes problems with rootwrap not
being able to kill processes as it fails to find a matching process.

This patch address that issue by adding that extra path to prevent
this issue from occuring.  This is problematic because it spams the
logs when periodic tasks run and try to kill process non-stop but
are blocked by rootwrap.

Change-Id: If97512a512603cb2dc548541c63d5c8dde527963
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/97/433297/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # RHEL invocation of the metadata proxy will report /usr/bin/python2kill_metadata2: KillFilter, root, python2, -15, -9 kill_metadata27: KillFilter, root, python2.7, -15, -9
deleted_lines: # RHEL invocation of the metadata proxy will report /usr/bin/pythonkill_metadata7: KillFilter, root, python2.7, -15, -9

commit_message:
Creating VM with different kind of ports

Create VM with normal, direct and direct-physical ports
and check connectivity to the VM

Adding option of sriov_support in config
Function for creating network with port
Adding option to setup_network_and_server to run with preexisting
network
Adding test for creation of VM with sriov direct port

added_lines: # Copyright 2016 Red Hat, Inc. # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from tempest import test import testtools from neutron.tests.tempest import config from neutron.tests.tempest.scenario import base CONF = config.CONF class NetworkSriovTest(base.BaseTempestTestCase): credentials = ['primary'] @testtools.skipUnless( CONF.neutron_plugin_options.sriov_support, "SRIOV is not supported on the setup") @test.idempotent_id('59f68d8c-f176-41f4-b927-c27132ad7098') def test_create_instance_with_network_port(self): create_port_body = {'binding:vnic_type': 'direct', 'name': 'port-sriov'} network = self.create_network_with_port(**create_port_body) self.setup_network_and_server(network=network) self.check_connectivity(self.fip['floating_ip_address'], CONF.validation.image_ssh_user, self.keypair['private_key'])

commit_message:
Check the default_prefixlen, When create or update a subnetpool

Add a function to check the default_prefixlen, when create or
update a subnetpool, if it is larger than network prefixlen.
Otherwise, it will be failed to allocate a subnet, When using
it.

Change-Id: I051b8d65c8901df500bbd8fde8775620313a7a92
Closes-bug: #1644433
Co-Authored-By: Rajiv Kumar <rajiv.kumar@nectechnologies.in>

added_lines: """This Class is a gathering of function for all need objects creation. Neutron objects, Nova server, key pairs. Additionally, an ssh connectivity check function is defined in this class """ """Resource_setup is an api/base.py function that creates a lists for each created type of objects: List for networks, seubnets, ports, flavors, etc This function adds creation of servers list and key pairs list """ """Deletes servers and its key pairs. cls.servers: A list of servers The deletion is performed by compute/base.py delete_server function. cls.keypair: A list of key pairs The deletion is performed by keypairs_client.py delete_keypair function. super(BaseTempestTestCase, cls).resource_cleanup() is an api/base.py function that cleans all the resources by going over the resource lists. """ """This function creates a keypair anf adds it to cls.keypairs list. #TODO- client name(str): Name of the keypair created """ """Create security group rules. #TODO: client rule_list: List of security group rules secgroup_id(str): The id of the security group to add rule to. """ """Router creation in an admin tenant, andd adding it to the cls.routers list. """ """Floting ip creation and association the VM. The fip is added to the cls.floating_ips list. """

commit_message:
Add a new option "--provider:flooding_vtep ip_address=IP_ADDR"
"[,dstport=UDPPORT]" to net-create.

This option is used to configure the VTEP of VXLAN network which
can't be found by neutron automatically.

Please help review:
Spec:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/282180

Neutron server code change:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/315896

OVS agent code change:
https://review.openstack.org/317309

Linux bridge agent code change:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/316596/

Partial-Bug: #1525059

commit_message:
Move neutron-metadata-agent config file

The Neutron configuration structure is difficult to understand and
there is no reason why the configuration files end with .ini . With this
change, neutron-metadata-agent no longer needs to have --config-file
switches (for neutron.conf and metadata_agent.ini) during startup
because oslo.config has sane defaults to automatically load

- /etc/$project/$project.conf
- /etc/$project/$program.conf
- /etc/$project/$project.conf.d/*.conf
- /etc/$project/$program.conf.d/*.conf

when no --config-file/--config-dir switches are given.

DocImpact: The new default sample configuration file path is
           etc/neutron/neutron-metadata-agent.conf.sample
UpgradeImpact: Same as DocImpact

Related-Bug: #1654152
Change-Id: Id51592fff63478d005331505053e61bfd0433c0c
Depends-On: I1fa7a7bbb80d299a7ccd46ac600664a81dd96a82
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/95/416595/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: output_file = etc/neutron/neutron-metadata-agent.conf.sample

commit_message:
Let --show-details show more info

The option --show-details of net-list currently has no effect,
it always prints 'id', 'name' and 'subnets' columns.
We should show more info while the option is specified,
for instance: 'tenant_id' and 'status'
as they are quite useful for operators especially in the
multi tenants scenario.

Change-Id: Ia5932bb23579ac656bf033f1658c426cee4fb24e
Closes-Bug: #1244551

commit_message:
Fix the regexp extracting the number of controllers

On a 3 controllers node setup, the neutronl3ha.yml file is always set due to
that regexp which is always true and always returning 1 as number of
controllers.

Closes-Bug: #1643866
Main Author: Athlan-Guyot sofer <sathlang@redhat.com>
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>

Change-Id: Icfe4fdc5762cc264f86cd2f513b5f5b53ad7cf75
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart-extras refs/changes/17/447017/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: set_fact: number_of_controllers="{{ deploy_args| regex_replace('^.*--control-scale +([0-9]+).*$', '\\1') | regex_replace('^[^ 0-9]+$', '1') }}"

commit_message:
Use detailRoute constant for path of details view

details view to constant using "horizon.app.core.detailRoute".

Closes-Bug: #1641250

commit_message:
Remove log translations

Log messages are no longer being translated. This removes all use of
the _LE, _LI, and _LW translation markers to simplify logging and to
avoid confusion with new contributions.

See:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-i18n/2016-November/002574.html
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-March/113365.html

Change-Id: Ia7f04dfa7e292b3ada28e28fdfe3da4b22b7b691

commit_message:
Remove log translations

Log messages are no longer being translated. This removes all use of the _LE, _LI, and _LW translation markers to simplify logging and to avoid confusion with new contributions.
See: http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-i18n/2016-November/002574.html http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-March/113365.html

Change-Id: I77f788e490de03754244cb10d7b4353338adf2fc

Change-Id: I1114611f6765e94dcab74943078066bb096f4078

commit_message:
Store user_domain in self._user_domain_id

Storing in self._user_domain was actually relying on the
oslo_context.RequestContext also storing in self._user_domain, however
this was renamed in change I203acefae8270bd3373b006fa096bea5ef3106f3
to _user_domain_id.

This change switches to _user_domain_id, which avoids infinite
recursion in the heat tripleo undercloud installer.

Change-Id: I1114611f6765e94dcab74943078066bb096f4078
Closes-Bug: #1663013
(cherry picked from commit b44b0c6970dc6a4d0f46e649d12aaff27a583f45)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/24/443224/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: return self._user_domain_id self._user_domain_id = user_domain

commit_message:
Add a NodeData class to roll up resource data

Formalise the format for the output data from a node in the convergence
graph (i.e. resource reference ID, attributes, &c.) by creating an object
with an API rather than ad-hoc dicts.

Change-Id: I7a705b41046bfbf81777e233e56aba24f3166510
Partially-Implements: blueprint stack-definition

subject: Tempest cleanup misguides its utility
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-08 10:12:05.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/cmd/cleanup.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tempest/commit/3238e2f3f745a01fe218fd1ec782f371f6bd6bb3', 'message': 'Tempest cleanup misguides its utility

Tempest tests clean up after themselves once they are done.
Only in exceptional circumstances when the setup.py is not able
to run is the tempest cleanup command useful.

The documentation for the command does not explain this and as
such changed it to properly explain the circumstances under which
it is useful.

Change-Id: Ic5abcfa1c85f7da0e8bc3dce446f12073854c707
'}]
commit_message:
Tempest cleanup misguides its utility

Tempest tests clean up after themselves once they are done.
Only in exceptional circumstances when the setup.py is not able
to run is the tempest cleanup command useful.

The documentation for the command does not explain this and as
such changed it to properly explain the circumstances under which
it is useful.

Change-Id: Ic5abcfa1c85f7da0e8bc3dce446f12073854c707
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/51/443051/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
[placement] Add Traits related table to the api database

This patch adds DB table `traits` and `resource_provider_traits` into
the api database.

The traits table is used to represent the trait. The resource_provider_traits
table is used to represent the relationship between trait and resource provider.

Part of implementation blueprint shared-resources-pike

Change-Id: I5c34bdd1423beab53cc4af45e016d9a9bba5ffda

commit_message:
Remove log translations

Log messages are no longer being translated. This removes all use of
the _LE, _LI, and _LW translation markers to simplify logging and to
avoid confusion with new contributions.

See:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-i18n/2016-November/002574.html
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-March/113365.html

Change-Id: I46b8cd57c6aa4f93b4574b429284f7dd77443028

commit_message:
Ignores "Not found" jobs when stopping jobs

While stopping an element's jobs (e.g.: VM), we are iterating
through its jobs and get the jobs that are still pending. These jobs
can finish while looping over them, resulting in "x_wmi Not found"
exceptions.

Skips job objects that are no longer found.

Change-Id: I73476d4d9651e6b5792a94a228796292b922e843
Closes-Bug: #1668260

commit_message:
hacking: Drop import_exceptions from tox.ini

Current hacking check actually does not check attribute-level
imports. We can safely drop import_exceptions from tox.ini.

noqa cleanup will be coming in subsequent patches.

Change-Id: Iee3e9cbf80b272cb71e658671913f8242f96f7e6

subject: nova-status: don't coerce version numbers to floats for comparison
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-20 10:59:50.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/cmd/test_status.py', 'nova/cmd/status.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/f2294fa7e5207ea037958932ab531f225c16263b', 'message': "nova-status: don't coerce version numbers to floats for comparison

As is comparison will fail when Placement API version 1.10 is
released, e.g. in the case: float('1.10') < float('1.4').

Use the helper provided by pkg_resources instead. The returned
values can be compared and sorted and have a string representation.

http://setuptools.readthedocs.io/en/latest/pkg_resources.html#parsing-utilities

Change-Id: Iaaca8f458671bd518b4c10c776f78b9c1ed803dd
"}]
commit_message:
nova-status: don't coerce version numbers to floats for comparison

As is comparison will fail when Placement API version 1.10 is
released, e.g. in the case: float('1.10') < float('1.4').

Use the helper provided by pkg_resources instead. The returned
values can be compared and sorted and have a string representation.

http://setuptools.readthedocs.io/en/latest/pkg_resources.html#parsing-utilities

Change-Id: Iaaca8f458671bd518b4c10c776f78b9c1ed803dd
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/49/447449/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
devstack: When Python 3 enabled, use Python 3

In order to have Ironic installed using Python 3 when running under a
Python 3 test job, we need to enable it as a Python 3 package.

The Python 3 job still doesn't pass. But this is needed as part of the
work.

Change-Id: I6a766bbb4250d76d458db8783631e4bd834859f3

commit_message:
Remove log translations

Log messages are no longer being translated. This removes all use of
the _LE, _LI, and _LW translation markers to simplify logging and to
avoid confusion with new contributions.

See:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-i18n/2016-November/002574.html
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-March/113365.html

Change-Id: I213db6f258f6f2bc010e1b6dc8069130f17800a7

commit_message:
VMAX driver - volumes part of CG not managed correctly

Volumes created as part of a clone CG operation (either from the
source CG or a CG snapshot) were not managed properly. This was
because the provider_location was not being set as part of the
volume_model_update. With this fix, the provider_location is set
properly for the new target Volumes which are created as part of
the cloning of the CG. Additionally, a random UUID is generated
before creating the volume and is assigned as the name of the
volume on VMAX. This UUID is stored as a part of a key-value pair
in the volume.s admin metadata. This UUID is used later to uniquely
identify the volume on the VMAX while doing a volume operation.

Change-Id: I16ab7e25202c8ce861d8654097cf17fcf9bc8295
Closes-Bug: #1669827

Fix some unit test comments

- Cisco CSR1kv FWaaS service plugin has been removed since
2be5839e5ba9c88a0a35c00de3712ed626a5796c.
We must use fwaasrouterinsertion instead.
- and minor fix

TrivialFix

commit_message:
Pass located tests directory in oslo debug

According to [1], we can passing a "-t" argument to
oslo_debug_helper to indicate the directory where tests
are located. This will solves ImportError exception.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslotest/features.html

Closes-Bug #1666560

Change-Id: I0ec9f53f75a946ec05ab54f1996a1e747f4d2dd8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/os-testr refs/changes/89/444789/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: commands = oslo_debug_helper -t os-testr/tests {posargs}

commit_message:
Use the openstack client cmd instead of cinder cmd

Try to use the openstack client command(OSC) instead of all cinder command. If
OSC command can not be found, then use cinder command.
Up to now, the commad "cinder quota-defaults" and "cinder quota-usage"
can not be replaced with OSC command.

Change-Id: I5d09ce38f4182ac72b3ef047a1dc18e8ed7f359f
Closes-Bug: #1672255

commit_message:
Pass located tests directory in oslo debug

According to [1], we can passing a "-t" argument to
oslo_debug_helper to indicate the directory where tests
are located. This will solves ImportError exception.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslotest/features.html

Change-Id: I496c0304b815ad830ac817236c4b10820f5f9290
Closes-Bug: #1666560
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/karbor refs/changes/82/444782/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: commands = oslo_debug_helper -t karbor/tests {posargs}

commit_message:
Allow to specify port security when creating a port

commit c886d8a2def188337e7768469b45dd51bc7f404e added a feature
to enable/disable port security when editing a port.
It sounds reasonable to allow this for port creation too.

Note that the current release note already covers this change,
so this commit does not add a new release note.

Related-Bug: #1634877

Change-Id: I85182fb1806fa24a0891abab1190a4246ba7c89e

commit_message:
Use ThemableSelectWidget for themable

Some places are not using ThemableSelectWidget, so
these select ui is not themable. This patch fix it.

Change-Id: I303a9cf8c6f8f651edf68973a2f5e16a8b04b26d
Closes-bug: #1669696

commit_message:
In drawer, handle 'priority' attribute conversely against row

'priority' attribute has be handled in drawer [1][2], but the behavior
is same as in rows. The behavior is that the items which have lower
priority are hidden from both of row and drawer when wid$

Drawer is used for the supplements against the row, so it should be
handled conversely.
It means that items appear in drawer when they are hidden from row.

This patch fixes it.

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/horizon/+bug/1648332
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/397132/

Change-Id: Ia0487a1d95ba16d764546cdb374fe786a0f0f648
Closes-Bug: #1651658

subject: VMAX driver - consistency group remove empty values
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-14 23:11:42.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/bf7648869b205059b882c627f71aff0843b3e5eb', 'message': 'VMAX driver - consistency group remove empty values

For consistency group volumetypes are split based on a comma
because volumetypes are represented as a single string. This
creates an empty value in the list. This fix removes empty
values from the list of volume types.

Change-Id: I8280989d25149e1f87ab2ffac0a61f1bc3321cff
Closes-Bug: #1664621
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2017-02-14 23:21:56.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/3bc704d2a3ed7c60ef3a0845444a10f19dabbb6a', 'message': 'VMAX driver - consistency group remove empty values

For consistency group volumetypes are split based on a comma
because volumetypes are represented as a single string. This
creates an empty value in the list. This fix removes empty
values from the list of volume types.

commit_message:
VMAX driver - consistency group remove empty values

For consistency group 'volume_type_id' is split based on a comma
because 'volume_type_id' is represented as a single string even
though it may contain multiple id. This creates an empty value in
the list. This fix removes empty values from the list of volume
types.

Change-Id: I8280989d25149e1f87ab2ffac0a61f1bc3321cff
Closes-Bug: #1664621

commit_message:
api/metadata/vendordata_dynamic: don't import Requests for its constants

Python-requests isn't really needed, don't import it to prevent
copy/paste of the anti pattern of accessing it's codes directly.

Fix one unit test that was returning a 204 but actually including data
in it, but expecting that data to not be used.

Change-Id: I9f6eda0c3e6f7d390abca5e9e4ebe059788ee11f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/39/434339/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: import requests if res.status_code in (requests.codes.OK, requests.codes.CREATED, requests.codes.ACCEPTED):

commit_message:
OSC Quota List

Implement Neutron feature of Quota List into
OpenStack Client.

Change-Id: Idf941acf8d00b136776b7381b877c56d82622f57
Partially-Implements: blueprint neutron-client-quota
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-openstackclient refs/changes/13/379813/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _xform_get_quota(d): res = [] res_info = {} res_info['floatingip'] = getattr(d, 'floatingip', '') res_info['id'] = getattr(d, 'id', '') res_info['network'] = getattr(d, 'network', '') res_info['port'] = getattr(d, 'port', '') res_info['rbac_policy'] = getattr(d, 'rbac_policy', '') res_info['router'] = getattr(d, 'router', '') res_info['security_group'] = getattr(d, 'security_group', '') res_info['security_group_rule'] = getattr(d, 'security_group_rule', '') res_info['subnet'] = getattr(d, 'subnet', '') res_info['subnetpool'] = getattr(d, 'subnetpool', '') res.append(res_info) return res class ListQuota(command.Lister): """Lists quotas for project or class""" def get_parser(self, prog_name): parser = super(ListQuota, self).get_parser(prog_name) parser.add_argument( 'project', metavar='<project>', nargs='?', help=_('List quotas for this project or class (name or ID)'), ) return parser def take_action(self, parsed_args): client = self.app.client_manager.network project = parsed_args.project data = client.get_quota(project) print(data) result = [] result += _xform_get_quota(data) print("result:", result) columns = ( 'floatingip', 'id', 'network', 'port', 'rbac_policy', 'router', 'security_group', 'security_group_rule', 'subnet', 'subnetpool', ) column_headers = ( 'Floatingip', 'Id', 'Network', 'Port', 'Rbac_policy', 'Router', 'SecurityGroup', 'SecurityGroupRule', 'Subnet', 'SubnetPool' ) return (column_headers, (utils.get_dict_properties( s, columns, ) for s in result))

commit_message:
Cleanup setUp method in Unit tests

fw_plugin and callbacks are already set to same values in parent class.
To avoid confusion "setUp" method is removed.

Change-Id: Id12876f0d1ca51f2fbb6f648eead2006913a58ec
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron-fwaas refs/changes/18/435918/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: def setUp(self): super(TestFirewallCallbacks, self).setUp(fw_plugin=FW_PLUGIN_KLASS) self.callbacks = self.plugin.endpoints[0]

commit_message:
OSC Network Flavor Profile

Implement Neutron feature of Network Flavor Profile
into OpenstackClient
This patch implements the following commands:
network flavor profile create
network flavor profile delete
network flavor profile list
network flavor profile show
network flavor profile set

SDK Version needed: 0.9.9

Change-Id: Ie6fe5e53122cfb2eda8d326851d54562739a8386
Partially-Implements: blueprint neutron-client-flavors
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-openstackclient refs/changes/83/396783/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: network_flavor_profile_create = openstackclient.network.v2.network_flavor_profile:CreateNetworkFlavorProfile

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-15 06:34:55.000000000', 'files': ['setup.cfg', 'tox.ini'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron-fwaas/commit/3aeee36bc7920b9d064c2cc5cd1b4cc47b1b93b3', 'message': 'Remove support for py34

The gating on python 3.4 is restricted to <= Mitaka. This is due to
the change from Ubuntu Trusty to Xenial, where only python3.5 is

Change-Id: I483587d1a53696ff406cdb59081e1274ff8c5dc0
'}]
commit_message:
Remove support for py34

The gating on python 3.4 is restricted to <= Mitaka. This is due to
the change from Ubuntu Trusty to Xenial, where only python3.5 is
available. There is no need to continue to keep these settings.

Change-Id: I483587d1a53696ff406cdb59081e1274ff8c5dc0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron-fwaas refs/changes/95/434095/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: envlist = py35,py27,pep8,pylint

commit_message:
consume ServicePluginBase from neutron-lib

Neutron-lib now contains the ServicePluginBase class and
thus is being removed from neutron [1]. This patch moves
all such references from neutron to neutron-lib in accordance
with the neutron-lib rehoming.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/441129/

Change-Id: I1fe162bc6bce1ad70ae0e722e8fd824b64475fe6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tap-as-a-service refs/changes/18/441318/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from neutron_lib.services import service_base

commit_message:
Use Sphinx 1.5 warning-is-error

With pbr 2.0 and Sphinx 1.5, the setting for treat sphinx warnings as
errors is setting warning-is-error in build_sphinx section.  Migrate the
setting from the old warnerrors one.

There are some invalid docstrings. These are cleaned up.

Change-Id: Ic6a028bab428b23255f36e5b2d64ee8d4d32978d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.policy refs/changes/08/446608/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: all-files = 1 warning-is-error = 1

commit_message:
Datera: extend volume if larger than snapshot

Extend volume if during create_volume_from_snapshot() the new volume
is larger than the snapshot it was created from. Added new test case.

Co-Authored-By: Xinli Guan <xinli@us.ibm.com>

Close-Bug: #1560613

Change-Id: Ia17a0e9f65ca570b6f97691a8701e9809f4960f8
Signed-off-by: Danny Al-Gaaf <danny.al-gaaf@bisect.de>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/46/296446/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @mock.patch.object(datera.DateraDriver, 'extend_volume') def test_create_volume_from_snapshot_success_larger(self, mock_extend): snapshot = _stub_snapshot(volume_id=self.volume['id']) extend_volume = _stub_volume(size=2) self.mock_api.side_effect = [stub_return_snapshots, None] self.driver.create_volume_from_snapshot(extend_volume, snapshot) mock_extend.assert_called_once_with(extend_volume, extend_volume['size']) size = 1 volume['size'] = kwargs.get('size', size)

Since pbr already landed and the old version of hacking seems not
work very well with pbr>=2, we should update it to match global
requirement.
Partial-Bug: #1668848

commit_message:
spec on asynchronous job management

1. What is the problem
When XJob receives a job message from service, it will register
the job in database and handle it asynchronously. Tricircle
need to provide API for users to query the job status and trigger
failed job if something happens unexpectedly. This patch provides
asynchronous job management specification, then we will develop
relevant API to manage the job according to this specification.

2. What is the solution for the problem
The new features functioning as job management APIs are covered
in this specification.

3. What the features need to be implemented to the Tricircle to
realize the solution
These asynchronous job management APIs in this specification need
to be implemented.

Change-Id: I58df65b042a8866c4d8d7f5a65a3f85bcf43b62b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tricircle refs/changes/04/438304/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ========================================= Tricircle Asynchronous Job Management API ========================================= Background ========== In the Tricircle, XJob provides cross OpenStack functionalities. It receives and processes jobs from the Admin API or Tricircle Central Neutron Plugin and handles them in an asynchronous way. For example, when booting an instance in the first time for the project, router, security group rule, FIP and other resources may have not already been created in the bottom OpenStack instance, these resources could be created asynchronously to accelerate response for the first instance booting request. Not like network, subnet, security group resources they must be created before a instance booting. Top OpenStack could send such creation jobs to bottom OpenStack(s) through XJob and then bottom OpenStack(s) handle them with their own speed. Apart from the job creation instruction, XJob can also handle the update and delete message from the top OpenStack. XJob server may strike occasionally so tenants and cloud administrators need to know the jobs' status and delete or redo these failed jobs if necessary. Asynchronous job management APIs provide such functionalities and they are listed as following: * Get the job Retrieve job entries from the Tricircle database with filters. We can filter them by job type, job status or project_id. In order to get the meaningful job entry list we employ project_id from the context object as a mandatory filter parameter. * Delete the job Delete the failed or duplicated old job entries from the Tricircle database. * Redo the job Redo the halted jobs brought by the XJob server corruption or network failures. * Create the job Create a job to manually synchronize resources if necessary. Data Model Impact ================= To implement the job management features, we need to modify the AsyncJob model and AsyncJobLog model and add project_id to them. When list the jobs, project_id is a mandatory parameter for filter. Dependencies ============ None Documentation Impact ==================== None References ========== None

subject: do not include context to exception notification
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-17 17:20:01.000000000', 'files': ['nova/exception.py', 'nova/tests/unit/test_exception.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/305cdb38db47258909ef83d5918c7c85ef9d7a5b', 'message': 'do not include context to exception notification

The wrap_exception decorator optionally emited a notification.
Based on the code comments the original intention was not to include the
context to that notification due to security reasons. However the
implementation did included the context to the payload of the legacy
notification.

Recently we saw circural reference errors during the payload serialization
of this notification. Based on the logs the only complex data structure
that could cause circural reference is the context. So this patch
removes the context from the legacy exception notification.

The versioned exception notification is not affected as it does not
contain the args of the decorated function.

Conflicts:
      nova/exception_wrapper.py

NOTE(mriedem): The conflict is due to some refactor in Newton:

(cherry picked from commit 3bf177a59cfd0b4e74dba256c3466ba2ea9bfbf7)
(cherry picked from commit a8a1915456a86f504d23f215867da730d436fe33)
(cherry picked from commit d0ee248bab6727555561c15998c58a0f11a5351b)

commit_message:
do not include context to exception notification

The wrap_exception decorator optionally emited a notification.
Based on the code comments the original intention was not to include the
context to that notification due to security reasons. However the
implementation did included the context to the payload of the legacy
notification.

Recently we saw circural reference errors during the payload serialization
of this notification. Based on the logs the only complex data structure
that could cause circural reference is the context. So this patch
removes the context from the legacy exception notification.

The versioned exception notification is not affected as it does not
contain the args of the decorated function.

Conflicts:
      nova/exception_wrapper.py
      nova/tests/unit/test_exception.py

NOTE(mriedem): The conflict is due to some refactor in Newton:
6329d721ef326488d5d660e4f68febf563ed93ab

Closes-Bug: #1673375
Change-Id: I1d217620e52d45595a3e0e49ed57b4ab33cd1688
(cherry picked from commit 3bf177a59cfd0b4e74dba256c3466ba2ea9bfbf7)
(cherry picked from commit a8a1915456a86f504d23f215867da730d436fe33)
(cherry picked from commit d0ee248bab6727555561c15998c58a0f11a5351b)

commit_message:
update the typo in setup.cfg from
"senlin.common.wsgi = senlin.common.wsgi:list_opts"
to
"senlin.api.common.wsgi = senlin.api.common.wsgi:list_opts"

If leaving not fixed, the following error is triggered
when running gen-config script to generate the configuration
files for senlin.

[root@jeguan-ctrl-01 senlin]# tools/gen-config
WARNING:stevedore.named:Could not load senlin.api.common.wsgi

Closes-Bug: #1674326
Change-Id: Icceb156725f63556f2ca66d2f17c4cf17419f783

As is known to all, MySQL server can operate in different SQL modes, 
and can apply these modes differently for different clients, 
depending on the value of the sql_mode system variable. 
DBAs can set the global SQL mode to match site server operating 
requirements, and each application can set its session SQL mode 
to its own requirements.
Modes affect the SQL syntax MySQL supports and the data validation 
checks it performs. This makes it easier to use MySQL in different 
environments and to use MySQL together with other database servers.


As below, I explain about the importance of SQL_mode in MySQL server.


>>> sql_mode="ALLOW_INVALID_DATES,ANSI_QUOTES,
ERROR_FOR_DIVISION_BY_ZERO,HIGH_NOT_PRECEDENCE,
IGNORE_SPACE,NO_AUTO_CREATE_USER,NO_AUTO_VALUE_ON_ZERO,

NO_UNSIGNED_SUBTRACTION,NO_ZERO_DATE,NO_ZERO_IN_DATE,
ONLY_FULL_GROUP_BY,PAD_CHAR_TO_FULL_LENGTH,PIPES_AS_CONCAT,
REAL_AS_FLOAT,STRICT_ALL_TABLES,STRICT_TRANS_TABLES"
>>> len(sql_mode)
407


So I changed the Table configurations and datastore_version_metadata 
which changed the column value from String(128) to String(512).


Change-Id: Ibd926045567a0bdd62002ffc4d69c5521fab3f45
'}]
commit_message:
fix bug#1672263 which table configurations.value
string(128)->string(512)


It's a fix about cli command when runs with: trove configuration-create.


when running: 
>trove configuration-create limit_128_test ' 
{ "sql_mode": "\"ONLY_FULL_GROUP_BY,STRICT_TRANS_TABLES,NO_ZERO_IN_DATE,
NO_ZERO_DATE,ERROR_FOR_DIVISION_BY_ZERO,NO_AUTO_CREATE_USER,
NO_ENGINE_SUBSTITUTION\"" } ' --datastore pxc --datastore_version pxc56

output:
>trove configuration-show xxxxx
the configuration value gets truncated when over 128 char.


As is known to all, MySQL server can operate in different SQL modes, 
and can apply these modes differently for different clients, 
depending on the value of the sql_mode system variable. 
DBAs can set the global SQL mode to match site server operating 
requirements, and each application can set its session SQL mode 
to its own requirements.
Modes affect the SQL syntax MySQL supports and the data validation 
checks it performs. This makes it easier to use MySQL in different 
environments and to use MySQL together with other database servers.


As below, I explain about the importance of SQL_mode in MySQL server.


>>> sql_mode="ALLOW_INVALID_DATES,ANSI_QUOTES,
ERROR_FOR_DIVISION_BY_ZERO,HIGH_NOT_PRECEDENCE,
IGNORE_SPACE,NO_AUTO_CREATE_USER,NO_AUTO_VALUE_ON_ZERO,
NO_BACKSLASH_ESCAPES,NO_DIR_IN_CREATE,NO_ENGINE_SUBSTITUTION,
NO_FIELD_OPTIONS,NO_KEY_OPTIONS,NO_TABLE_OPTIONS,
NO_UNSIGNED_SUBTRACTION,NO_ZERO_DATE,NO_ZERO_IN_DATE,
ONLY_FULL_GROUP_BY,PAD_CHAR_TO_FULL_LENGTH,PIPES_AS_CONCAT,
REAL_AS_FLOAT,STRICT_ALL_TABLES,STRICT_TRANS_TABLES"
>>> len(sql_mode)
407


So I changed the Table configurations and datastore_version_metadata 
which changed the column value from String(128) to String(512).


Change-Id: Ibd926045567a0bdd62002ffc4d69c5521fab3f45

commit_message:
Enable to specify which vm fixed-ip to publish

This change enables to specify which vm fixed-ip will be associated to a
floating ip using:

 openstack server add floating ip <vm> <fip> --fixed-ip-address <ip>

Closes-Bug: #1624524
Change-Id: I2ddb68c5873bfed7293b0e661d1adbe111681136

Remove support for py33

Python 3.3 is not supported from Mitaka, as per Infra.
This patch removes the support and add py35 for the same.

commit_message:
Jsonify meter and meter rule functional tests

Some functional tests try to parse the CLI table output
format, that cause much work on parse string by using
regular expression. Using json format in functional tests
is better and easier way, this patch reworks for meter and
meter rule related tests.

Change-Id: I1f2a95c873a4ed23dd1afa4040900a1c7704d0bf
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-openstackclient refs/changes/54/439854/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import json name1 = uuid.uuid4().hex name2 = uuid.uuid4().hex description = 'fakedescription' json_output = json.loads(self.openstack( 'network meter create -f json ' + self.name1 + ' --description ' + self.description)) self.name1, json_output.get('name'), False, json_output.get('shared') 'fakedescription', json_output.get('description') ) json_output_2 = json.loads(self.openstack( 'network meter create -f json ' + self.name2 + ' --description ' + self.description)) self.assertEqual( self.name2, json_output_2.get('name'), ) # Check if default shared values self.assertEqual( False, json_output_2.get('shared') ) self.assertEqual( 'fakedescription', json_output_2.get('description') 'network meter delete ' + self.name1 + ' ' + self.name2, json_output = json.loads(self.openstack( 'network meter create -f json --description Test1 --share ' + self.name1)) json_output.get('description'), True, json_output.get('shared'), json_output_2 = json.loads(self.openstack( 'network meter create -f json --description Test2 --no-share ' + self.name2)) json_output_2.get('description') False, json_output_2.get('shared') raw_output = json.loads(self.openstack('network meter list -f json')) name_list = [item.get('Name') for item in raw_output] self.assertIn(self.name1, name_list) self.assertIn(self.name2, name_list) # Clean up raw_output = self.openstack( 'network meter delete ' + self.name1 + ' ' + self.name2) self.assertOutput('', raw_output)
deleted_lines: import re @classmethod def setUpClass(cls): # Set up some regex for matching below cls.re_name = re.compile("name\s+\|\s+([^|]+?)\s+\|") cls.re_shared = re.compile("shared\s+\|\s+(\S+)") cls.re_description = re.compile("description\s+\|\s+([^|]+?)\s+\|") name1 = uuid.uuid4().hex name2 = uuid.uuid4().hex raw_output = self.openstack( 'network meter create ' + name1, ) name1, re.search(self.re_name, raw_output).group(1), 'False', re.search(self.re_shared, raw_output).group(1) ) raw_output = self.openstack( 'network meter create ' + name2, name2, re.search(self.re_name, raw_output).group(1), 'network meter delete ' + name1 + ' ' + name2, name1 = uuid.uuid4().hex raw_output = self.openstack( 'network meter create --description Test1 --share ' + name1, ) self.addCleanup(self.openstack, 'network meter delete ' + name1) re.search(self.re_description, raw_output).group(1), 'True', re.search(self.re_shared, raw_output).group(1), name2 = uuid.uuid4().hex raw_output = self.openstack( 'network meter create --description Test2 --no-share ' + name2, ) self.addCleanup(self.openstack, 'network meter delete ' + name2) re.search(self.re_description, raw_output).group(1), 'False', re.search(self.re_shared, raw_output).group(1), raw_output = self.openstack('network meter list') self.assertIsNotNone(re.search(name1 + "\s+\|\s+Test1", raw_output)) self.assertIsNotNone(re.search(name2 + "\s+\|\s+Test2", raw_output))

commit_message:
Reduce wait condition signal number

With more then 5% of failure rate in gate. We decide to reduce the possibility
of conflict by reduce the number of signal. Will try to resume the
number back, once we feel confortable.

Change-Id: I90e1d26a67a349f897d895f750d8e57fae98ec1f
(cherry picked from commit 411daeae894c760f9e208540b03fe59422860e70)

commit_message:
Delete the copy operation of telegraf plugin

There is no files in the directory of "config" currently
If keep it,the container can't start

Change-Id: Id44a6458e50ae7b3ca2312937ce23bd36165b39e
Closes-Bug:#1673691
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible refs/changes/42/447742/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Add allowed_address_pairs support in tacker CP

Currently the tacker connection point (CP) support Virtural IP only if
the security group is off (via anti_spoofing_protection off).
But it's good to have both by supporting allowed_address_pairs.
This RFE is for this purpose.

Closes-Bug: #1664805
Change-Id: I9fa1d4b69f8cbf51b047110cd6cfa61fb91a0bf0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tacker refs/changes/87/435187/7 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: allowed_address_pairs: type: list required: false

commit_message:
Removes unnecessary utf-8 encoding

This patches removes unnecessary utf-8 encoding in
deployment/puppet/osnailyfacter/modular/astute/vcenter_hooks.py
utils/fuel-tasklib/tasklib/graph.py
utils/fuel-tasklib/tasklib/schemas.py
utils/fuel-tasklib/tasklib/setup_hooks.py
utils/fuel-tasklib/tasklib/tests/test_graph.py
utils/fuel-tasklib/tasklib/validator.py

Change-Id: I2a86fb20f16f32da2b1c5010bdc33c33fdf84823

subject: Fuel plugin builder v5
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-05 03:16:56.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/fuel-plugins/commit/c04d0e9a1bca2a5be4598a046b4b9c060651d22b', 'message': "Fuel plugin builder v5

- Now it is possible to deliver Fuel release configuration using the Fuel plugin
  [bp/release-as-a-plugin](https://blueprints.launchpad.net/fuel/+spec/release-as-a-plugin)
  Using flag ``is_release: true`` in ``metadata.yaml: releases:`` section you coud
  define new fuel release.
  Also you could define ``base_release: release_template.yaml`` inside release
  description to share single template between multiple releases.
- ``*_path`` directive in is now supported in ``metadata.yaml``.
  Now you could require folder, external file or merged glob output using keys
  like ``deployment_tasks_path: 'dt.yaml'``
- It is possible to define graphs linked with plugin or releases
  directive inside ``metadata.yaml``, see the examples.
- All yaml root files is not not required except ``metadata.yaml``.
- Templates and examples for the Fuel plugins package ``v5.0.0`` are added.
- Fuel plugin builder is refactored to make all configurations traceable and
  decouple logic working with file system with validation logic and building
  logic.
  [LP1539598](https://bugs.launchpad.net/fuel/+bug/1539598)
- Docker environment for building and creating plugins example.
- Experimental ``JSON`` manifests support added.
- Schemas are aligned with Fuel versions.
- Advanced build process reporting.
  Now FPB trying to detect all possible problems in plugin configuration
  and report them instead of failing of first of them and also could warn user
  without stopping execution.
- Now it is possible to build plugin package v4.0.0 without ``tasks.yaml``

Change-Id: I55d0313db7cd64ab16802a75ff0d9edd16782d01
Implements-blueprint: release-as-a-plugin
Closes-Bug: #1539598
Closes-Bug: #1552248
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-09-05 03:22:57.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/fuel-plugins/commit/ecf49bc4a9b03bf42b18129c6b64f829aa52f88d', 'message': "Fuel plugin builder v5

commit_message:
Fuel plugin builder v5

- Now it is possible to deliver Fuel release configuration using the Fuel plugin
  [bp/release-as-a-plugin](https://blueprints.launchpad.net/fuel/+spec/release-as-a-plugin)
  Using flag ``is_release: true`` in ``metadata.yaml: releases:`` section you coud
  define new fuel release.
  Also you could define ``base_release: release_template.yaml`` inside release
  description to share single template between multiple releases.
- ``*_path`` directive in is now supported in ``metadata.yaml``.
  Now you could require folder, external file or merged glob output using keys
  like ``deployment_tasks_path: 'dt.yaml'``
- It is possible to define graphs linked with plugin or releases
  directive inside ``metadata.yaml``, see the examples.
- All yaml root files is not not required except ``metadata.yaml``.
- Templates and examples for the Fuel plugins package ``v5.0.0`` are added.
- Fuel plugin builder is refactored to make all configurations traceable and
  decouple logic working with file system with validation logic and building
  logic.
  [LP1539598](https://bugs.launchpad.net/fuel/+bug/1539598)
- Docker environment for building and creating plugins example.
- Experimental ``JSON`` manifests support added.
- Schemas are aligned with Fuel versions.
- Advanced build process reporting.
  Now FPB trying to detect all possible problems in plugin configuration
  and report them instead of failing of first of them and also could warn user
  without stopping execution.
- Now it is possible to build plugin package v4.0.0 without ``tasks.yaml``

Change-Id: I55d0313db7cd64ab16802a75ff0d9edd16782d01
Implements-blueprint: release-as-a-plugin
Closes-Bug: #1539598
Closes-Bug: #1552248
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-plugins refs/changes/18/365418/18 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Plugin name name: fuel_plugin_example_v5_releases # Version of plugin package package_version: '5.0.0' # Human-readable name for your plugin title: Fuel plugin package v5.0.0 with releases example # Plugin own version version: '0.0.1' # Description description: This is an example of 'release' as the plugin # Minimum required fuel version fuel_version: ['10.0'] # Specify license of your plugin licenses: ['Apache License Version 2.0'] # Specify author or company name authors: ['Specify author or company name'] # A link to the plugin's page homepage: 'https://github.com/openstack/fuel-plugins' # Specify a group which your plugin implements, possible options: # network, storage, storage::cinder, storage::glance, hypervisor, # equipment groups: [] ## Change `false` to `true` if you are specifying plugin and it can be ## installed in the environment after the deployment. ## For releases definitions this flag will be ignored. #is_hotpluggable: false # introduce new bundle releases: - name: 'ExampleRelease' #required description: 'Example Release Description' #required operating_system: 'ubuntu' #required, or its alias "os" version: '0.0.1' #required is_release: true networks_path: metadata/networks.yaml volumes_path: metadata/volumes.yaml roles_path: metadata/roles.yaml network_roles_path: metadata/network_roles.yaml components_path: metadata/components.yaml attributes_path: attributes/attributes.yaml vmware_attributes_path: attributes/vmware.yaml node_attributes_path: attributes/node.yaml nic_attributes_path: attributes/nic.yaml bond_attributes_path: attributes/bond.yaml deployment_scripts_path: deployment_scripts/ repository_path: repositories/ubuntu # deployment_tasks is used in fuel 9.0.x as a deployment graph # don't use if in new fuel versions deployment_tasks: graphs/deployment_tasks.yaml graphs: - type: provisioning graph: name: provisioning graph tasks_path: graphs/provisioning.yaml - type: deployment graph: name: default deployment graph tasks_path: graphs/deployment_tasks.yaml - type: deletion graph: name: deletion tasks_path: graphs/deletion.yaml - type: network_verification graph: name: network_verification tasks_path: graphs/network_verification.yaml - type: default # default was used in fuel 9.0.x as a deployment graph graph: name: deployment-graph-name tasks_path: graphs/default.yaml - type: default # default was used in fuel 9.0.x as a deployment graph graph: name: deployment-graph-name tasks_path: graphs/deployment_tasks.yaml

commit_message:
Refactor hosts task

Add a function to filter out duplicate deleted hosts
in case the duplicate records are present in the
deleted_nodes file.

Change-Id: I8b07c5850c1c8e8e28e9d96638f847e1d80fdcdb
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library refs/changes/02/419902/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: require 'spec_helper' describe 'host_hash_deleted_nodes' do it { is_expected.not_to be_nil } it 'failes if the nodes hash is not a hash' do is_expected.to run.with_params('node1', 'node2').and_raise_error /should be a Hash/ end let(:hosts_hash) do { 'node-1' => { :ensure => 'present' }, 'node-2' => { :ensure => 'present' }, 'node-3' => { :ensure => 'present' }, } end let(:deleted_nodes) do %w(node-2 node-4 node-5) end let(:result) do { 'node-1' => { :ensure => 'present' }, 'node-2' => { :ensure => 'present' }, 'node-3' => { :ensure => 'present' }, 'node-4' => { :ensure => 'absent' }, 'node-5' => { :ensure => 'absent' }, } end it 'adds deleted nodes to the hosts hash' do is_expected.to run.with_params(hosts_hash, deleted_nodes).and_return(result) end end

commit_message:
Get rid of custom wrap_db_retry call in sync_allocations

Just for consistency, get rid of the last direct call to
wrap_db_retry and instead use neutron.db.api.retry_db_errors
in the sync_allocations code so we don't potentially get
bitten by slight inconsistencies between the two.

TrivialFix
Related-Bug: #1673243

Change-Id: I975c7d0ec84698d277acbbec6d9cfec5c03439aa
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/52/446152/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: Resolve evaluation of bifrost-keystone-client-config
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-20 22:19:36.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/bifrost/commit/aeeb0d01e24299e87caa035c390bf5907eba0152', 'message': 'Resolve evaluation of bifrost-keystone-client-config

At the moment, there are a few places where the default is not
set in that role which is now enforced to always run.  If it is
ran locally, SUDO_USER is not present and evaluates to a missing
key on dictionary.

This refactors the default setting back to the role inclusion
and makes sure that the default filter returns root instead. The
trailing true is to force it to run for values that evaluate to
false as the lookup plugin will return an empty string.

set in that role which is now enforced to always run.  If it is
ran locally, SUDO_USER is not present and evaluates to a missing
key on dictionary.

This refactors the default setting back to the role inclusion
and makes sure that the default filter returns root instead. The
trailing true is to force it to run for values that evaluate to
false as the lookup plugin will return an empty string.

Related-Bug: #1674483

Change-Id: I31a2a33e2fb3b004dfec179426c7d1b4c72301d2
'}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2017-03-20 22:28:30.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/bifrost/commit/ba969895d85440f20968175609ae2e014209e25e', 'message': 'Resolve evaluation of bifrost-keystone-client-config

At the moment, there are a few places where the default is not

This refactors the default setting back to the role inclusion

commit_message:
Resolve evaluation of bifrost-keystone-client-config

The owner parameter for some of the tasks for the Keystone
client configuration does not have a default fallback, which
results in a failure if SUDO_USER is not set in the environment.

This patch adds the missing default fallbacks so that it can safely
evaluate to root if it missing from the environment.

Related-Bug: #1674483

Change-Id: I31a2a33e2fb3b004dfec179426c7d1b4c72301d2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/bifrost refs/changes/13/447713/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: user: "{{ lookup('env', 'SUDO_USER') | default('root', true) }}"

subject: RBD driver doesn't flatten image when clone depth > configured value.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-10 01:11:46.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/rbd.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/volume/drivers/test_rbd.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/d742b68b38b6786c1da37029c6e6edf9a3cf6c34', 'message': "RBD driver doesn't flatten image when clone depth > configured value.

RBD driver has a rbd_max_clone_depth config option which would trigger
image flatten operation when a RBD image has been chain-cloned to that
value.  But the driver only trigger flatten when actual clone depth
equals rbd_max_clone_depth.  There are cases where actual clone depth
is bigger than rbd_max_clone_depth (for example: admin somehow changed
rbd_max_clone_depth from a bigger value to a smaller value),
auto-flatten won't be triggered.  This change allows RBD driver to
flatten image has been cloned >= rbd_max_clone_depth.

Change-Id: I6a69431df07ce2ca6770ba3e72aa26d02b6dbef3
Closes-Bug: #1644129
"}]
commit_message:
RBD driver doesn't flatten image when clone depth > configured value.

RBD driver has a rbd_max_clone_depth config option which would trigger
image flatten operation when a RBD image has been chain-cloned to that
value.  But the driver only trigger flatten when actual clone depth
equals rbd_max_clone_depth.  There are cases where actual clone depth
is bigger than rbd_max_clone_depth (for example: admin somehow changed
rbd_max_clone_depth from a bigger value to a smaller value),
auto-flatten won't be triggered.  This change allows RBD driver to
flatten image has been cloned >= rbd_max_clone_depth.

Change-Id: I6a69431df07ce2ca6770ba3e72aa26d02b6dbef3
Closes-Bug: #1644129

commit_message:
overcloud_containers.yaml defaults

The only uploader implementation is 'docker' so this is now made the
default.

docker.io is set to the default registry.

This makes overcloud_containers.yaml easier to maintain.

Change-Id: I1f6b751ae844d804125c4ae7b022e3ce4de9723d

Revert "Revert "Fix RPC scale issue using cast instead of fanout v1""

Address FirewallAgentApi signature changes issue

Change-Id: I68cbf7403a17ddba49cc5943fb110c1d772e8834

commit_message:
Load Glance DB metadefs

This will load default metadata definitions into Glance when syncing the
DB.

Closes-Bug: 1664995
Change-Id: Id043e36b32516ae077239f5af0b6017104e99b83
(cherry picked from commit bdd52684d67d9ee30f51606ac64b64b82f581c69)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-glance refs/changes/14/447614/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # # Class to load default Glance metadata definitions # # == Parameters # # [*extra_params*] # (optional) String of extra command line parameters to append to the # glance-manage db_load_metadefs command. These will be inserted in the # command line between 'glance-manage' and 'db_load_metadefs'. # Defaults to '' # class glance::db::metadefs( $extra_params = '', ) { include ::glance::deps include ::glance::params exec { 'glance-manage db_load_metadefs': command => "glance-manage ${extra_params} db_load_metadefs", path => '/usr/bin', user => 'glance', refreshonly => true, try_sleep => 5, tries => 10, logoutput => on_failure, subscribe => [ Anchor['glance::install::end'], Anchor['glance::config::end'], Anchor['glance::dbsync::end'] ], } }

subject: Enable allowed address pairs
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-15 03:09:25.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tricircle/commit/fe1aa83ba2707df4b33801b6284c8fc6d1d92d2f', 'message': 'Enable allowed address pairs in central plugin.

1. What is the problem?
To implement LBaaS in the Tricircle, we need to let Octavia use central
neutron to manage resources. However, the central plugin still not
support allowed address pairs. Moreover, after creating a load balancer,
Octavia will update security rules of the amphora. But the Tricircle
cannot support IPv6 well.

2. What is the solution to the problem?
Enable allowed address pairs in central neutron.
Ignore seg rules of IPv6 in central plugin.

3. What the features to be implemented in the Tricircle
to realize the solution?
No new features.

Change-Id: I5c4f1bf1b146d5fdf49c14d43f7226d81770e667
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2017-03-15 10:53:58.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tricircle/commit/62a90e21151f8ee37f60dba6859ced0aef386482', 'message': 'Ignore seg rules of IPv6 in central plugin

1. What is the problem?
After creating a load balancer, Octavia will update security rules of
the amphora. But the Tricircle cannot support IPv6 well.

2. What is the solution to the problem?
Enable allowed address pairs in central neutron.
Ignore seg rules of IPv6 in central plugin.

3. What the features to be implemented in the Tricircle
to realize the solution?
No new features.

Change-Id: I5c4f1bf1b146d5fdf49c14d43f7226d81770e667
'}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2017-03-16 01:46:59.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tricircle/commit/58007fc37379191471b486443a5df625bbdfaa88', 'message': 'Eable allowed address pairs

1. What is the problem?
Currently, the allowed-address-pairs is not supported in the Tricircle.
Moreover, after creating a load balancer, Octavia will update security rules of
the amphora. But the Tricircle cannot support IPv6 well.

2. What is the solution to the problem?
Enable allowed address pairs in central neutron.
Ignore seg rules of IPv6 in central plugin.

3. What the features to be implemented in the Tricircle
to realize the solution?
No new features.

Change-Id: I5c4f1bf1b146d5fdf49c14d43f7226d81770e667
